title: Data Analyst, Business Analytics - Sales & Operations
description:
Are you passionate about leveraging data to solve interesting business problems? On a daily basis we collect and analyze millions of data points to help to solve the problems of parking. We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst to join our growing Business Analytics team and help us make it faster and easier for people to get where they need to go.

The Business Analytics team at FLASH owns the flow of... data from its raw state in our data warehouse to the BI tools and data products that consume it. This means our analysts are regularly building/updating ETLs and data models via SQL, surfacing data in our BI tools via dashboards and interactive data products, and working with stakeholders across multiple departments to formulate goals and build a deeper understanding of our two-sided marketplace. Your day-to-day work will be SQL and BI-tool heavy, but will also require you to operationalize ambiguous business problems into answerable questions, translate the data you pull into effective visualizations, and clearly communicate key findings.

This role in particular will be primarily focused on sales and operations, which means working on things like building and scheduling automated reports in Looker, designing impactful internal-facing dashboards to drive insight and efficiency, onboarding recently acquired data sources through knowledge-building and SQL-based data modeling, supporting the development of a new customer-facing reporting portal, and more. We're in an exciting and rapidly evolving industry that requires constant innovation, evaluation, and iteration. Help us perfect the parking experience and make an impact on the industry!

#LI-remote

What you'll be doing
‚Ä¢ Work with variety of data sources - extracting knowledge and actionable information from massive datasets
‚Ä¢ Build and flesh out data models in our Redshift database for use in regular and/or automated reporting and analysis
‚Ä¢ Expand the breadth of questions that internal stakeholders can solve independently by adding on to and refining our heavily-used BI tools, Looker and Tableau
‚Ä¢ Work with the sales and operations teams to understand and anticipate their needs, building a data environment that enables them to understand current state and surpass performance expectations
‚Ä¢ Continuously strive for a deeper understanding of our business drivers
‚Ä¢ Convey your work and results to a wide variety of internal and external stakeholders ‚Äì nerds and non-nerds
‚Ä¢ Evaluate process inefficiencies and identify areas where you can create, automate, and develop tools (SQL-based or otherwise)
‚Ä¢ Diagnose data-related bugs in our SQL code and ensure they are resolved in a timely manner
‚Ä¢ Support the business with ad hoc and regular reporting

What you bring to the table
‚Ä¢ 2+ years supporting sales (preferred), operations, or other business team in a professional analytics capacity
‚Ä¢ A love for insights, innate curiosity, and a deep desire to find ways to create value
‚Ä¢ Very strong communication skills with both technical and non-technical audiences
‚Ä¢ Passion for automation
‚Ä¢ Comfort in complex, new data environments and understanding of data structures
‚Ä¢ Possess the SQL skills necessary to build aggregated and evolving data models to support a variety of on going reports, as well as quickly respond to ad-hoc requests as needed
‚Ä¢ Experience with some flavor of data visualization and dashboard building in a BI tool (we use Looker and Tableau)
‚Ä¢ The business sense to understand why you're pulling data and whether it seems accurate...not just pulling it
‚Ä¢ You like to formulate the right questions versus just seeking answers to make sure the best and smartest decisions get made

What you get
‚Ä¢ The tools - or additional tools, if need be - to get the job done
‚Ä¢ A data engineering team to help you get clean, reliable data and maintain the ETLs you build
‚Ä¢ A team of high functioning, collaborative, and capable analysts with a desire to both share their knowledge and learn from you
‚Ä¢ Solve big problems across departments and for leadership
‚Ä¢ Opportunity to directly impact success for a rapidly growing business in a fast-paced industry

title: Data Analyst - (Remote - US)
description:
Mediavine is seeking a Data Analyst to join our Engineering team. We are looking for someone who enjoys solving interesting problems and wants to work with a small team of talented engineers on a product used by thousands of publishers. Applicants must be based in the United States.
About Mediavine
...
Mediavine is a fast-growing advertising management company representing over 8,000 websites in the food, lifestyle, DIY, and entertainment space. Founded by content creators, for content creators, Mediavine is a Top 20 Comscore property, exclusively reaching over 125 million monthly unique visitors. With best-in-class technology and a commitment to traffic quality and brand safety, we ensure optimal performance for our creators.
Mission & Culture

We help content creators build sustainable businesses. From educational tools and cutting-edge plugins to ad technology that maximizes earnings without slowing down your site, our motivation is ensuring your brand and business grow in every respect.

We are striving to build an inclusive and diverse team of highly talented individuals that reflects the industries we serve and the world we live in. We are committed to creating a culture where everyone feels welcomed. We are looking for individuals that will challenge us to continuously evolve and make Mediavine the employer of choice for people of all backgrounds. We strongly encourage minorities and individuals from underrepresented groups in technology to apply for this position.

Diversity and inclusion aren't platitudes to us; we take them seriously. Have a look at our team and read through our blog posts to learn more about our values and to discover if Mediavine is the place for you!

Position Title & Overview

The Data & Analytics team consists of data analysts, data engineers and analytics engineers working to build the most effective platform and tools to help uncover opportunities and make decisions with data here at Mediavine. We partner with Product, Support, Ad Operations and other teams within the Engineering department to understand behavior, develop accurate predictors and build solutions that provide the best internal and external experience possible.

The Data Analyst role will be assisting the analysts in their support of the business and helping to guide the direction through data based decisions. They will provide support in developing analytical processes and make use of data in meaningful ways that produce positive results.

Our current analytics toolkit consists of Tableau, Metabase and dbt running on top of a Snowflake data warehouse. We are exploring new BI tools and expect this position to add value in the implementation of this tool.

Essential Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Work collaboratively with the product, support, engineering and ad ops to develop analytic monitoring and measurement tools that meet immediate needs
‚Ä¢ Develop self service tools that allow internal users to answer the next question beyond the initial ask
‚Ä¢ Assist on assigned projects through all phase
‚Ä¢ Increase the company‚Äôs analytical ability and comfort level through approachable analyses for non-analytical stakeholders and audience specific guidance
‚Ä¢ Create visualizations to monitor business performance and uncover interesting trends for investigation
‚Ä¢ Communicating requirements to the data engineering members of the team to make sure the platform can support the business needs
‚Ä¢ Lead anomaly investigation helping other teams identify root cause and present findings
‚Ä¢ Define and create exception based alerting that is meaningful for specific audiences along with investigation and remediation steps
‚Ä¢ Comfortably test and critique the process we use for exploratory data analysis and A/B testing. This includes helping stakeholders decide on testing strategy, generating baselines, approximating sample sizes and performing analysis of test results
‚Ä¢ Work with data engineers and analytics engineers to standardize transformation logic in the dbt layer for consistency and ease of exploration by end users
‚Ä¢ Adhere to data analysis code best practices and analysis standards

Location:
‚Ä¢ Applicants must be based in the United States.

You Have:
‚Ä¢ 4+ years of experience in a data analyst role
‚Ä¢ Extremely strong SQL skills (CTEs, window functions, optimization)
‚Ä¢ Experience with one or more major BI tools (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Comfortable working with multi-TB cloud data warehouses (Big Query, Snowflake, Redshift)
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Ad Tech, Google Ad Manager and all of it‚Äôs fun quirks (so fun)

Nice to haves:
‚Ä¢ Experience with web analysis such as creating product funnels, user behavior, and paths
‚Ä¢ Experience with designing and analyzing experiments including but not limited to A/B testing
‚Ä¢ Experience with R or Python for creating data models or data manipulation
‚Ä¢ The ability to make your teammates laugh (it wouldn‚Äôt hurt if you were fun to work with is what I‚Äôm saying)
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with event tracking systems (NewRelic, Snowplow, etc)
‚Ä¢ Experience with dbt and Snowflake
‚Ä¢ Remote work environment
‚Ä¢ Travel opportunities (remember those!?)
‚Ä¢ Comprehensive benefits including 401k, Health, Dental, and Vision insurance
‚Ä¢ Learning allowance
‚Ä¢ Generous Vacation/Time off policies
‚Ä¢ Additional side benefits such as home-office upgrades, tuition reimbursement, paid gym memberships and wellness retreats, upgraded flights, cool swag and more
‚Ä¢ Company match charitable donations

Mediavine is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst (ie. data analyst, business...
description:
LawnStarter is a marketplace that makes lawn care easy for homeowners while helping small businesses succeed. We've raised millions in venture funding and are growing fast. Are you a driven senior data analyst interested in helping give millions of American‚Äôs the freedom to spend time on what truly matters?

Working at LawnStarter offers you a chance to help solve the most important challenges in... the marketplace industry in an environment that‚Äôs fun, collaborative, and innovative. We are looking for smart, creative individuals who are passionate about innovation and aren't afraid to show it.

üöÄ The story so far üöÄ

We have built something that:
‚Ä¢ Is loved by our customers. Hear what they have to say
‚Ä¢ Has industry leading profitable acquisition channels - SEO, paid, et.al.
‚Ä¢ Our investors are psyched about
‚Ä¢ Generates healthy revenue with good margins (in double digit millions)

And we are just getting started. While we have been focused on lawn mowing, we have huge opportunities in front of us: geography expansion, related services (weeding, mulching, bush trimming, fertilization, landscaping, et.al.) and adjacencies (such as commercial segment - think property managers who look after 100+ properties) to go after. The entire home outdoor services market is 100B+ in the USA alone.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing‚Ä¶
‚Ä¢ Build repeatable processes and reporting packages to empower both sales/ops leaders and reps with critical operational data related to sales strategy and execution.
‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain standardized operational reports, dashboards, and data sources to monitor overall business health, data integrity, and other key objectives and performance indicators.
‚Ä¢ Support ongoing analysis of business performance. Inform executive decisions.
‚Ä¢ Collect, analyze, evaluate, and report data to track performance and metrics.
‚Ä¢ Partner closely with Product Strategy and Planning to provide ad-hoc analysis in support of strategic projects and initiatives.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate cross-functionally within the Sales/Ops/Product/Finance organization to ensure consistent reporting standards and processes
‚Ä¢ Experienced. 3-5 years as a data analyst in consulting, finance, sales/marketing operations, or product management. Bachelor's Degree required, ideally degrees in STEM, advanced degree is a plus.
‚Ä¢ Excellent Communicator. You have a strong ability to convey complex concepts and information to a broad audience, including working with executive level leaders. You‚Äôre a natural leader with an ability to build things from scratch. A knack for creating structure wherever needed.
‚Ä¢ Problem Solver. You have a passion for creating scalable reporting products that are intuitive to use and enable others with data. You approach challenges with a sense of urgency and accountability. You‚Äôre excited to become an expert in the Tableau, extract insight from data, and the wherewithal to develop findings and recommendations that transcend the numbers.
‚Ä¢ Organized. You can juggle and prioritize a high-volume workload while handling details accurately, in a timely manner, and under pressure. Your time management skills are impeccable and you can multi‚Äêtask, handle frequent interruptions, and make decisions in a fast-paced environment.
‚Ä¢ Technical. Strong knowledge of relational database technologies, Excel, and ability to become an expert in Tableau‚Äôs full product suite. Existing experience with Tableau and SQL is most ideal. You have the ability to perform complex analysis

Technical skills
‚Ä¢ 3-5 years of experience in analytics
‚Ä¢ SQL proficient and practice on a weekly basis, at least 2-3 years of experience
‚Ä¢ R/Python programming experience 2-3 years experience
‚Ä¢ Bi reporting experience 2-3 years: Tableau, Power BI, Looker, Domo, and others dashboards

How you can make a difference at LawnStarter

We use data to drive decisions and to help our outdoor service pros to grow customers and revenue.

Here‚Äôs an example:

How can LawnStarter optimize driving routes for our mowing pros so they can get more jobs done in a day? That all hinges on data. And how can that make a difference in people‚Äôs lives? One of our missions is to help pros earn a good living so they can better support their family. If we can help them get one more job completed, that is extra money for them.

We‚Äôre LawnStarter. We mow grass -- so you might say we are cutting edge -- with lawns and data. We also offer all sorts of other outdoor services. Join us and use data to help us do more, faster, and better. Be Data Driven is one of our core values, and you can work from anywhere. If you like working with data, you will love it here at LawnStarter!

Great Culture: One of the top places to work in Austin in 2018, 2019, and 2020, and in the US in 2021, we are all about the team. That‚Äôs why we have spent a massive amount of time finding humble, passionate, and smart folks that you will get to work with every day.

Supporting self-care: We have unlimited vacation policy and will nudge you to utilize it to care for yourself. We will operate together to ensure you have the support you need.

Supporting career growth: We actively invest in this area by carving a budget for training and skills development you seek.

Healthcare benefits: Medical, dental, vision and 401k

Fully remote position: Work remotely from anywhere you want

title: Data Analyst
description:
Job Description

Phoenix LiDAR Systems builds custom, survey-grade laser mapping systems, and automation software for flight planning, acquisition, and post-processing, enabling clients to collect detailed, 3D topographic information for a wide range of commercial and research applications, including engineering, construction, mining, and more. We are a remote sensing solutions company based in... North Austin, TX, and we are looking to add a dynamic person to our team.

The Data Analyst reports to the Data Manager and typically performs tasks to support a variety of projects, while working both with office staff and field staff, by organizing and processing incoming information, and producing final reports and project deliverables. In this role you will work closely with the office personnel to coordinate and execute field work related to remote UAS flights. Once data is acquired you will process and analyze remote sensing information in the office.

Responsibilities

‚óè Analyze remotely sensed geospatial data from a variety of active and passive sensors

‚óè Calibrate integrated lidar systems and perform detailed quality control

‚óè Generate multi-sensor data-fusion derived products that adhere to end user specifications.

‚óè Perform GNSS/INS coupled trajectory processing.

‚óè Analyze and investigate data and produce detailed reports and recommendations

‚óè Maintain a deep understanding of evolving hardware systems and their data

‚óè Provide technical support for data, software, and hardware inquiries

‚óè Conduct technical trainings, presentations, and webinars

‚óè Work closely with field operations, production, and technical support teams

‚óè Participate in the planning or development of mapping projects.

‚óè Consult with remote sensing scientists, surveyors, cartographers, or engineers to determine project needs.

‚óè Contribute to the development of, and adhere to strict data quality standards

‚óè Operate remote sensing equipment, such as survey cameras, sensors, or scanners.

‚óè Monitor raw data quality during collection and make equipment corrections as necessary.

‚óè Ability to troubleshoot systems and be proactive in finding solutions

‚óè Ability to survey ground control points using GPS receivers and appropriate method of survey

‚óè Provide technical support (brief & de-brief) to field crews

Qualifications

‚óè Minimum bachelor‚Äôs degree in related fields such as Mathematics, Geography, or Computer Science.

‚óè 3-5 years of progressive experience in geospatial or other related projects.

‚óè Experience with applications of remote sensing data

‚óè Expertise in various relevant processing and analytic software, including but not limited to TerraSolid, Lastools, ArcGIS, QGIS, Inpho, etc.

‚óè Comprehensive understanding of coordinate reference systems and other geodetic principles

‚óè To travel and perform work independently as instructed. Travel is possible, mostly located in the US, and may require overnight staying for 5+ days/nights

‚óè Strong listening, writing and verbal communication skills

‚óè Proven work history, strong work ethic and team-player attitude

Additional Information

Youll love:

‚óè Our competitive compensation package.

‚óè Collaborating with a diverse, dynamic, and close-knit team

title: Data Analyst / Report Writer
description:
Currently, we have an opening for Data Analyst / Report Writer for our direct client in Austin, TX. Please find the position details given below. If you are interested please apply.

Title: Data Analyst / Report Writer...

Location: Austin, TX

Duration: 4 Months (with the option to extend if needed for project completion)

Job Description:

The Data Analyst is responsible for ingesting, cleaning, mining and transforming data. The analyst will also monitor data quality and analyze various forms of data while providing reports and interpreting results. The Data Analyst will be working to migrate reports and integrate systems to a new vendor application.

Project Synopsis
‚Ä¢ Work with a team of developers to convert existing report queries written for an Oracle Database to work in DB2.
‚Ä¢ Convert existing Oracle packages, stored procedures, and functions to DB2.
‚Ä¢ Create an ETL process to export data from DB2 to an Edfi compliant set of CSV files.

Information Analysis:
‚Ä¢ Mines and interprets data, monitors, and analyzes key metrics and interprets performance and provides insight into the data and metrics generated.
‚Ä¢ Convert existing PL/SQL Queries, stored procedures, and functions to work with a DB2 database.
‚Ä¢ Writes, maintains and/or updates queries to develop analysis in response to queries from vendors and internal customers
‚Ä¢ Ensures accuracy of database results used as inputs to data analysis.

Information Management:
‚Ä¢ Work with data owners to understand the data schema, data flow and develop data dictionaries.
‚Ä¢ Coordinates data feeds and updates and sources additional data required for integration and migration of a new vendor.
‚Ä¢ Determines the value of new internal and external data sources, merges disparate data sets, ingests data, cleans, and munges data, derives metrics, and transforms the data into usable information.
‚Ä¢ Assists vendor development teams in creating and maintaining data reporting models.
‚Ä¢ Assists in the development and implementation of data monitoring and measurement systems.
‚Ä¢ Ensures the quality of specific data stores for collection, tracking and reporting of research data.

ETL:
‚Ä¢ Designs and develops ETL(extract, transform and load) processes to feed data stores from disparate data sources.
‚Ä¢ Develops and documents the systems, processes and logic required to expose the existing data sets in the warehouse to end users for reporting and analysis purposes.
‚Ä¢ Delivers quality data integration projects.
‚Ä¢ Designs and develops BI/Analytics views for stakeholders.

Qualifications:

Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics or related field and 3 years of experience in database development using Oracle PL/SQL and DB2 or an equivalent combination of education and work-related experience

Preferred Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Experience with K-12 educational institution data
‚Ä¢ Data warehousing and ETL processes
‚Ä¢ Experience working with DB2 databases
‚Ä¢ All aspects of designing, developing, testing and implementing ETL solutions

title: Data Analyst
description:
About Hearth

Hearth is a Fintech company helping home improvement contractors grow and manage their business. Our SaaS platform provides over 14,000 contractors the financial tools they need to close more business, including financing solutions, invoicing, payment collections, insurance products, all in one, modern system designed specifically for the home improvement industry...

Backed by 8VC, Founders Fund, and other prominent leaders in Silicon Valley, Hearth has raised over $50M and is one of the fastest growing companies in the home improvement space.

About this Role:

We are looking for a technical and experienced Data Analyst to join our Data Team. Data is key to Hearth for informing product decisions, optimizing operations and guiding company strategy. This team member will partner closely with and have opportunities to work on high impact projects that span across many departments. As one of the key Data Analysts to the Data Team, you will help define key business, performance metrics and own areas of data including operational and product analytics.

Here's what you'll do:
‚Ä¢ Leverage data to understand users and their product usage, developing insights that apply to product, marketing, and business strategy
‚Ä¢ Work with Product, Engineering, Marketing, Rev Ops, and Finance teams to identify important questions around how to define key metrics
‚Ä¢ Establish and manage KPIs that measure the health of the business, product performance, and customer experience quality
‚Ä¢ Create reporting, visualizations, and dashboards to guide and monitor our business and allow team members to take action quickly
‚Ä¢ Develop frameworks, tools, and best practices to apply data insights towards business questions
‚Ä¢ Analyze experiment data, communicate results, and drive decisions

Here's what we're looking for:
‚Ä¢ Solid analytical foundation; you have a good understanding of product and business metrics, knowledge of statistical methods
‚Ä¢ Fluency in SQL and some experience with either Python or R
‚Ä¢ Comfortable manipulating and analyzing very large data sets with high dimensionality and complexity
‚Ä¢ Experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Mode, Looker, dbt, etc.
‚Ä¢ Strong attention to detail; your analyses are always high quality, accurate, and easy to understand
‚Ä¢ You have a scrappy get things done mentality, and the ability to work in a self-guided manner
‚Ä¢ Strong communicator; you can crisply communicate actionable data-driven insights to all audiences
‚Ä¢ An interest or some experience in data science and machine learning is a plus!
‚Ä¢ Experience in leading experimentations (A/B testing) is also a plus!
‚Ä¢ 1-3+ years of relevant work experience in a quantitative or analytical role at a SaaS or technology company

Benefits
‚Ä¢ Mission-driven, values-based culture.
‚Ä¢ Competitive pay.
‚Ä¢ Growth opportunities as we continue to grow and scale.
‚Ä¢ Generous PTO, plus paid company holidays.
‚Ä¢ Stock options.
‚Ä¢ Medical, dental, and vision options.
‚Ä¢ 401(k) package.
‚Ä¢ Upbeat, casual and fun office environment and culture.
‚Ä¢ Company-sponsored events & happy hours.
‚Ä¢ Pup-friendly office.
‚Ä¢ Stocked kitchen with cold brew, snacks & drinks to keep you energized!

Location:

Austin, TX, San Francisco, CA, Remote

More About Us

Hearth embraces diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records

title: People Data Analyst
description:
At Meta, we pride ourselves on making data-informed decisions. This includes not only decisions we make about our platform, which serves over 2 billion users, but also how we learn more about our most valuable asset - our people. Our HR Partnerships People Analytics team plays a key role in surfacing data, insights and research to HRBPs and Business Leaders informing key strategic decisions to... help attract, develop, motivate, and retain top talent. The People Data Analyst is the link between our HRBP community and complex data requirements that cannot be accessed through self solve channels. We are currently looking for Data Analysts who share our passion for finding the right data to solve business challenges while recognizing opportunities to build new functionally and improve existing systems. The successful candidate will be curious and inquisitive, have strong critical thinking and analytical skills, and is passionate about informing and influencing stakeholders with data and insights.

People Data Analyst Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Address ad hoc reporting and analytics requests, with an eye on addressing the underlying business challenge
‚Ä¢ Leverage tools, such as SQL, Tableau, Visier, and Excel to drive analytics and enable client self-service on routine queries
‚Ä¢ Recognize patterns and changing requirements to identify opportunities to build new analytics and reporting capabilities to support program evaluation and operations
‚Ä¢ Intake on business needs and apply contextual knowledge in order to scope data requests, synthesize insights, and recommend solutions to key business partners in collaboration with others
‚Ä¢ Educate our partners on the different tools and services that are available to them
‚Ä¢ Effectively communicate with cross functional partners and internal teams to deliver solutions in a timely fashion
‚Ä¢ Proactively manage stakeholder expectations, manage escalations and resolve issues in a timely manner

Minimum Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ 3+ years of experience working with SQL or relational database
‚Ä¢ 2+ years of experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Visier, MS PBI, Qlik, SAS VA, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Experience manipulating large data sets
‚Ä¢ Experience initiating and driving projects to completion with minimal guidance
‚Ä¢ Experience prioritizing requests and working with stakeholders across multiple diverse cross functional areas
‚Ä¢ Demonstrate judgment and discretion when dealing with highly sensitive people data and business issues
‚Ä¢ Experience working in a fast-paced environment

Preferred Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Experience with R or Python
‚Ä¢ Experience with Tableau or Visier
‚Ä¢ Experience working with HR/organizational people data preferred (e.g., headcount, turnover, recruiting metrics, and other people analytics)
‚Ä¢ Experience with data management, specifically with building data systems and validating reports from disparate systems
‚Ä¢ Experience in HR analytics using HR systems and tools such as Workday, Visier, Salesforce etc.

Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. title: BI Data Analyst and Specialist
description:
Job Description

We are currently sourcing for a BI Data Analyst/Specialist to work at Client in Westlake, TX...

Senior Business Analyst, Data and Analytics
This is an opportunity to provide your insights and enable Workplace Investments to make the data-driven decisions required to meet their strategic objectives.

Req Notes:
WI in particular supporting Communication Consultants, Sales & Product Analyst, Campaign Analyst, etc (not our normal groups). Manager is wanting someone with good visualization skills, knows their way around data, can query data (SQL) and do reporting (Excel, Tableau). They use SQL, Sequel, Visualization, Tableau must have and like to have Alteryx.

The Expertise Were Looking For
Bachelors or equivalent with 5+ years of experience
In depth knowledge in a variety of analytics techniques including: profiling, data mining, modeling, statistical analysis and campaign measurement
Experience working with data environments and strong knowledge in querying language and/or querying applications (SQL, Alteryx, BRIO)
Strong in MS Office Package usage skill especially MS Excel. Very strong spreadsheet and relational database skills

The Purpose of Your Role
The Senior Business Analyst will report to the Vice President of Business Intelligence and will be responsible for the filling the growing demand for business intelligence across WI.

The Skills You Bring:
You have a passion for leveraging data to drive better business decision-making through statistical, econometric modeling, and technological techniques
You have a deep understanding of analytical techniques and how they can be applied to address particular problem characteristics
You have a strong analytical and problem-solving skills, particularly in the areas of strategy development, business analysis, risks and opportunity assessment
You have a working knowledge of analytic technologies (e.g. Alteryx, SAS, SQL, R, Python, BRIO, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, etc.)
You know how to acquire data from multiple sources/environments and transform it so it can be used for analytics
You have the ability to think on your feet and respond effectively when priorities change.

The Value You Deliver
Developing and delivering analytical data and insights to solve business problems
You enable Workplace Solutions to make objective, informed decisions
You provide opportunities for innovation through analytics capabilities and implementation of new technologies

title: HR Analytics Analyst
description: Company Description Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive. When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging - where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world - helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement. Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone. Job Description We are actively searching for People Analytics Analyst with a strong understanding of people data, workforce planning and... recruiting processes, plus a passion for data and analytics. People Analytics Analyst will be a critical part of the People Analytics team, which is responsible for designing, developing, delivering People Analytics & Insights, including the development and delivery of recurring and ad-hoc analysis and customized scorecards/dashboards. The People Analytics team is also responsible for People data strategy and data visualizations, the People Analytics analyst will provide support to this team by Developing and delivering of People scorecards/dashboards, analyzing, and interpreting the data to provide the organization with insights using Tableau, Power BI and/or MS Excel Consolidating and analyzing People data from multiple sources (Workday, SmartRecruiters, MS Excel and more) Analyzing data to ensure integrity/accuracy and structure data to help support or provide business recommendations This person will be part of the People Analytics team working closely with Talent Acquisition and Workforce Planning and will engage with IT, Talent Management, Workforce Planning, Diversity & Inclusion and others to optimize utilization of metrics and analytics data. We are looking for someone who can deliver recruiting trend/ROI analysis, dashboards and recommendations that will enable our leaders to make informed business decisions, drive productivity and efficiencies to reduce or control costs. In this role, you will leverage your expertise and knowledge to measure the success of key strategies and initiatives across the company. You will have the ability to conduct various analysis, measurement, reporting, data visualization, and compelling storytelling. Additional Information Essential Functions You will use tools such as Excel, Powerpoint, Tableau, Power BI or infographics to deliver reports and dashboards You will create routine reports and prepare analysis of recruiting trends for existing programs and new initiatives You will partner with People Analytics team members to create Recruiting and Workforce Planning models, templates, and documentation You will design and recommend dashboards with key metrics for talent acquisition operations to better align resources and drive better decision making You will identify, analyze and forecast trends into meaningful visualizations and develop presentations for leadership as needed You will produce and present ad hoc, weekly, monthly and quarterly talent acquisition analysis reports to support business data activity reporting needs You will work with People Business Partners and Talent Acquisition Leaders to develop, maintain and drive usage of dashboards that display real time and on-demand KPIs for the Talent Acquisition, Talent Sourcing and Workforce Planning and People Ops. You will evaluate trends on process and measuring organizational effectiveness and make recommendations for further optimization You will lead the analytical approach of special projects or key business initiatives of the organization including developing timeline and objectives, performance standards, and engaging stakeholders from cross functional departments such as Communication, Diversity& Inclusion and University Recruiting Programs You will lead process improvements to ensure high integrity and accuracy of recruiting data through audits and governance Qualifications Basic Qualifications: ‚Ä¢ 2 years of work experience with a Bachelor's Degree or an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA) with a concentration in a quantitative or related field such as marketing, human resources, data analytics, business analytics, computer science, engineering, economics, math or statistics. Preferred Qualifications: ‚Ä¢ Bachelor's Degree with a concentration in quantitative or related field such as marketing, human resources, data analytics, business analytics, computer science, engineering, economics, math, or statistics ‚Ä¢ 3 or more years of experience developing reports in an enterprise reporting tool with proficient knowledge of databases and business systems ‚Ä¢ 3 or more years of previous experience using research, data, and external information sources to support decision making ‚Ä¢ You are highly proficient in Excel and Tableau Reporting ‚Ä¢ You have at least 1 years of experience in recruitment ATS and/or HRIS technology ‚Ä¢ You have proven understanding of predictive analytics and other business-related data analysis strategies ‚Ä¢ You have UI/UX experience orexperience creating user-centric data visualization ‚Ä¢ Strong technical aptitude - advanced skills with various applications and systems including MS Office, SQL language and Tableau Prep Additional Information Visa has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Work Hours: Varies upon the needs of the department. Travel Requirements: This position requires travel5-10% of the time. Mental/Physical Requirements: This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers. Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law. Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable local law, including the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code

title: Sr. Data Analyst, Business Operations
description:
About Homeward

Buying a home should be an exciting milestone. But all too often, it's stressful, especially in a competitive market or when you're buying and selling at the same time. So we're redesigning the homebuying experience. We're a fast-paced real estate startup that empowers agents to help homebuyers buy with cash. We buy homes on behalf of our partners' clients with our cash, then the... client buys the home back from us.

Founder and CEO Tim Heyl, a 10-year industry veteran and owner of one of the fastest-growing agent teams in the country, started Homeward in 2018. In fact, he bought our first customer's home with his own life savings. Today we offer two services ‚Äî Buy with cash and Buy before you sell.

We've raised more than $160MM in equity capital from top-tier venture investors, including Norwest, Blackstone Alternative Asset Management, Adams Street, Javelin, and LiveOak. Our leadership team includes experts from the real estate, mortgage, and technology industries.

About the opportunity

Homeward's massive growth over the last twelve months and continued plan for more growth, the need and desire for meaningful, clean, concise data is also growing. The ideal candidate will contribute to tackling that ever growing need. You have strong analytical, technical, and visualization skills. This role will work on providing level two and three insights by creating and publishing reports and ensuring accuracy is maintained throughout Homeward's product changes and evolution. This is an opportunity to help support and strengthen the already existing analytical skills outside of the core team and create 'Power Users' to enable self-serve insights.

This position is not eligible for Visa sponsorship.

In this role you will:
‚Ä¢ Report to our Head of Business Analytics and partner with stakeholders to develop a business analytics roadmap for improving the company wide availability, speed and quality of data/analysis that accelerates decision making
‚Ä¢ Provide innovative analytical insight, supporting various functions across Homeward
‚Ä¢ Assist with the development and ongoing refinement of Homeward's canonical data model in partnership with the data engineering and product teams
‚Ä¢ Deliver a broad range of outputs; dashboards, deep-dive analysis, NPS reporting, segmentation work, etc
‚Ä¢ Be data subject matter expert for company's OKR roadmaps & guiding teams to metrics, data points, and outcomes
‚Ä¢ Launch a training program to introduce new team members to data at Homeward with the goal of empowering and upskilling members of all internal teams to serve up their own data and insights
‚Ä¢ Support development, maintenance and organization of performance reporting and management dashboards for all of Homeward's functional areas of operations and optimizations

What you'll bring:
‚Ä¢ 5+ years of proven experience in business analytics, business intelligence or comparable role; preference for experience within high-growth startups and/or top-tier mgmt consulting
‚Ä¢ Experience creating, maintaining, supporting metrics within a BI tool (Mode, Looker, Tableau preferred)
‚Ä¢ Expert proficiency in SQL (Standard SQL, BigQuery, PostgreSQL); bonus points for experience with Python
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated ability to synthesize independently generated data points into a cohesive analysis, and clearly communicate the results of complex analyses to a wide audience in a credible fashion
‚Ä¢ Strong organizational, planning, quantitative and analytical skills; strategic and creative thinking with keen business judgment, focus, and ability to see the "big picture"
‚Ä¢ Excellent interpersonal skills and have experience working directly with senior leadership
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and relationship-building skills
‚Ä¢ Tangible experience building something from the ground up

Our Values

THE GOLDEN RULE

Whether we're dealing with colleagues or customers, we follow The Golden Rule, treating others the way we want to be treated. It's a simple rule, but it's also significant: we don't prioritize money or growth over people, and we practice empathy at every opportunity.

CALM FOCUS

We work in tech and build solutions for real estate. Both are fast-paced and stressful industries. So it's important that we focus on the larger objective rather than rushing from one task to the next. If something is out of scope, we say "No." If something feels rushed, we pump the brakes. This calm focus helps us create solutions our customers love.

ONE TEAM, ONE DREAM

Big problems require big solutions. We look at our customers' experience holistically, and recognize that solving them requires collaboration across teams. This approach extends to cooperation among our three affiliate companies ‚Äî Homeward, Homeward Mortgage and Homeward Title ‚Äî and produces a more integrated homebuying experience

title: Lead Data Analyst
description:
Position Overview:

FemTec is looking for a Lead Data Analyst to play a crucial role in orchestrating our analytics workflows. This role will work across teams to gather requirements, design and build data models, and evaluate to obtain and share insights with other teams (marketing, finance, product, etc.) and manage our analytics team. The Lead Data Analyst will collaborate with data engineers... and data scientists in the Business Intelligence team to generate reports and visualizations in Metabase (and assorted other tools) for internal and external consumption. This position reports directly to the VP of Business Intelligence and sits in an org alongside data scientists and data engineers.

Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with cross teams to understand strategy/execution tactics and help us make better, data-driven business decisions.
‚Ä¢ Model clean datasets for analysis using dbt and SQL.
‚Ä¢ Understand existing metrics/data availability across our analytics platform, which includes fivetran, dbt, Metabase, Databricks, and Heap.
‚Ä¢ Develop primary and secondary metrics and dashboards to track customer health across the entire customer journey, including acquisition, retention, and engagement.
‚Ä¢ Create dashboards and reporting that answers direct questions, and also support self-service reporting and best practices across non-technical stakeholders.
‚Ä¢ Advise and advocate for data and reporting best practices across our technical and non-technical teams.
‚Ä¢ Grow and manage a team of analysts that build and maintain our analytics and reporting.

Requirements
‚Ä¢ Undergraduate degree or equivalent training/education
‚Ä¢ 4+ years in product or data analytics
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of marketing analytics (growth, traffic, attribution, incrementality)
‚Ä¢ Experience with git and comfort with the concept of versions and version control in code
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in SQL for modeling and querying data
‚Ä¢ dbt experience is a plus

A successful candidate
‚Ä¢ Uses disciplined structured logic to explain trends and concepts using available data
‚Ä¢ Enjoys collaborating with technical and non-technical stakeholders
‚Ä¢ Investigates and searches for their own answers, but doesn‚Äôt hesitate to ask for help or clarity when needed
‚Ä¢ Sees inefficient or unscalable processes and is empowered to improve them.
‚Ä¢ Is interested in learning about media measurement, including MMM, MTA, incremental lift studies, and A/B testing, as well as an understanding of strengths and weaknesses of each measurement methodology

title: Business intelligence data analyst
description:
At Pitney Bowes, we do the right thing, the right way. As a member of our team, you can too.

We have amazing people who are the driving force, the inspiration and foundation of our company. Our thriving culture can be broken down into four components : Client. Team. Win. Innovate...
‚Ä¢ Are passionate about client success.
‚Ä¢ Enjoy collaborating with others.
‚Ä¢ Strive to exceed expectations.
‚Ä¢ Move boldly in the quest for superior and best in market solutions.

Job Description : You are :

You are :

A strong Business Intelligence Data Analyst who enjoys solving complex problems using cutting edge business solutions in order to support our Global eCommerce Analytics Delivery, Return and Fulfillment Services business.

This individual will conduct analysis of functional processes in order to identify areas of improvement, which will require developing complex Business Intelligence solutions.

You are an individual who will learn to understand our customer‚Äôs journey, utilizing actionable data at every touchpoint.

This is a truly unified brand experience and unique engagement opportunity where you will be recognized as a Techno-Functional Analyst at the Enterprise level.

You will deliver a competitive advantage in the ever-changing world of global commerce through data analytical insights.

You will :
‚Ä¢ Conduct analysis of functional business processes to identify areas of improvement by developing complex BI solutions.
‚Ä¢ Develop business cases in the support of process changes.
‚Ä¢ Prepare BI dashboards, reporting, and data analysis needs.
‚Ä¢ Perform ad-hoc data pulls and analyses.
‚Ä¢ Address bugs and data issue flows for established dashboards
‚Ä¢ Conduct complicated and detailed analyses of data relative to applicable project.
‚Ä¢ Utilize data visualization software products to enhance understanding of data analyses.
‚Ä¢ Utilize background in Data Analytics, SQL, R , Python and Microsoft Suite tools and software.
‚Ä¢ Use statistical methods to analyze data and generate useful business reports and models.
‚Ä¢ Identify and recommend new ways to save money by streamlining business processes.
‚Ä¢ Assists in the development of metrics to assess the impact of logistics practice guidelines.
‚Ä¢ Develops and runs queries to support assigned projects.

Your background :

As a Business Intelligence Data Analyst, you have :
‚Ä¢ 4+ years of experience working as an Analyst (analytical position).
‚Ä¢ Must have hands-on experience in developing complex SQL queries.
‚Ä¢ Experience working with Python / R for automation is desirable.
‚Ä¢ Must have experience in creating dashboards in Tableau and / or PowerBI.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Statistical methods and models.
‚Ä¢ Ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of a team.
‚Ä¢ Strong attention to details.
‚Ä¢ Critical-thinking and problem-solving skills.
‚Ä¢ Capable of prioritizing multiple projects while still achieving deadlines.
‚Ä¢ Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Graduate level preferred.

We will :

‚Ä¢ Offer comprehensive benefits globally ( pbprojectliving.com )

Pitney Bowes is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer that values diversity and inclusiveness in the workplace.

Women / Men / Veterans / Individuals with Disabilities / LGBTQ+ are encouraged to apply.

All interested individuals must apply online. Individuals with disabilities who cannot apply via our online application should refer to the alternate application options via our Individuals with Disabilities link.

title: GIS Analyst
description:
Are you passionate about the open source GIS ecosystem? Do you want to grow your career as a geospatial data expert on a team that is passionate about open source software and working on complex client problems?

Do you have the technical know-how with the right mix of soft skills to partner with top-notch data scientists to answer key questions and create data visualizations that make insights... pop?

We are looking for a GIS Analyst to help us continue to grow makepath into an elite geospatial data science team.

Prerequisites:
‚Ä¢ Perform GIS data development, integration and analysis, produce maps and graphics, and extract, analyze and report different types of geospatial data.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency with commonly used GIS desktop software and geodatabase products/tools.
‚Ä¢ Strong expertise in preprocessing spatial data.
‚Ä¢ Keen ability to think spatially and determine what tools are needed to solve specific problems.
‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of commonly used geographic data formats.
‚Ä¢ Ability to give recommendations for best practices for handling and analyzing with different kinds of geospatial datasets.
‚Ä¢ Provide innovative location analysis and geospatial planning tools that support client strategy.
‚Ä¢ Extract insights from geographic data through various GIS technical capabilities.
‚Ä¢ Leverage open source GIS tools to deliver dynamic visual stories to support decision-making that can have a tactical or strategic geographic impact.
‚Ä¢ Utilize code in GIS to automate data and map processing.
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Geography, GIS, Computer Science, or related discipline.
‚Ä¢ Strong background in analytics and statistical methods.
‚Ä¢ We offer flexible work hours, but you are expected to be available for meetings and general interactions from Monday to Friday from 9 am to 5 pm (Central US Time Zone)

Bonus Points:
‚Ä¢ 3-5 years of GIS industry experience.
‚Ä¢ Contribution to Open Source libraries within the Python / PyData ecosystem
‚Ä¢ Recognition of data analysis as both an art and a science.
‚Ä¢ Experience with widely-used open source GIS software such as QGIS, GRASS and GeoPandas
‚Ä¢ Experience with JavaScript, Python, SQL and R
‚Ä¢ Experience working with Jupyter notebooks
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with advanced analytics for machine learning and artificial intelligence applications
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with cloud technologies including Azure or AWS

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in JavaScript and Arcade
‚Ä¢ Experience working in a sprint/agile environment

Research & Development Areas:
‚Ä¢ Geospatial Analysis
‚Ä¢ Data visualization
‚Ä¢ Artificial Intelligence

Soft Skills:
‚Ä¢ Teamwork. Developing software for our clients means continuous interaction with other members of the makepath team and considering client input and requirements.
‚Ä¢ Communication. As a remote job, good virtual communication is essential for a good relationship with other team members.
‚Ä¢ Be detail-oriented. Yes, we are design-driven and want the perfect pixel! Without giving up agility, of course.
‚Ä¢ Creativity. 'Out of the box' thinking results in innovative solutions for our customers' problems.
‚Ä¢ Problem-solving. Keep an open mind to learn all the time.
‚Ä¢ Persistence. Never giving up on a problem or project, despite how difficult it is.
‚Ä¢ Ownership and proactivity. You have full autonomy to think of solutions, as long as they are delivered with responsibility and organization

title: Data Analyst
description:
Phoenix LiDAR Systems builds custom, survey-grade laser mapping systems, and automation software for flight planning, acquisition, and post-processing, enabling clients to collect detailed, 3D topographic information for a wide range of commercial and research applications, including engineering, construction, mining, and more. We are a remote sensing solutions company based in North Austin, TX... and we are looking to add a dynamic person to our team.

The Data Analyst reports to the Data Manager and typically performs tasks to support a variety of projects, while working both with office staff and field staff, by organizing and processing incoming information, and producing final reports and project deliverables. In this role you will work closely with the office personnel to coordinate and execute field work related to remote UAS flights. Once data is acquired you will process and analyze remote sensing information in the office.

Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Analyze remotely sensed geospatial data from a variety of active and passive sensors
‚Ä¢ Calibrate integrated lidar systems and perform detailed quality control
‚Ä¢ Generate multi-sensor data-fusion derived products that adhere to end user specifications.
‚Ä¢ Perform GNSS/INS coupled trajectory processing.
‚Ä¢ Analyze and investigate data and produce detailed reports and recommendations
‚Ä¢ Maintain a deep understanding of evolving hardware systems and their data
‚Ä¢ Provide technical support for data, software, and hardware inquiries
‚Ä¢ Conduct technical trainings, presentations, and webinars
‚Ä¢ Work closely with field operations, production, and technical support teams
‚Ä¢ Participate in the planning or development of mapping projects.
‚Ä¢ Consult with remote sensing scientists, surveyors, cartographers, or engineers to determine project needs.
‚Ä¢ Contribute to the development of, and adhere to strict data quality standards
‚Ä¢ Operate remote sensing equipment, such as survey cameras, sensors, or scanners.
‚Ä¢ Monitor raw data quality during collection and make equipment corrections as necessary.
‚Ä¢ Ability to troubleshoot systems and be proactive in finding solutions
‚Ä¢ Ability to survey ground control points using GPS receivers and appropriate method of survey
‚Ä¢ Provide technical support (brief & de-brief) to field crews

Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Minimum bachelor‚Äôs degree in related fields such as Mathematics, Geography, or Computer Science.
‚Ä¢ 3-5 years of progressive experience in geospatial or other related projects.
‚Ä¢ Experience with applications of remote sensing data
‚Ä¢ Expertise in various relevant processing and analytic software, including but not limited to TerraSolid, Lastools, ArcGIS, QGIS, Inpho, etc.
‚Ä¢ Comprehensive understanding of coordinate reference systems and other geodetic principles
‚Ä¢ To travel and perform work independently as instructed. Travel is possible, mostly located in the US, and may require overnight staying for 5+ days/nights
‚Ä¢ Strong listening, writing and verbal communication skills
‚Ä¢ Proven work history, strong work ethic and team-player attitude

Youll Love

Additional Information
‚Ä¢ Our competitive compensation package.
‚Ä¢ Collaborating with a diverse, dynamic, and close-knit team

title: Product Data Analyst
description:
OnlineMedEd's purpose is to change how education is approached, delivered, and learned. We leverage education, technology, and research together to drive it all forward. Our philosophy is simple: medical knowledge belongs to no one, so medical education should be accessible to everyone. So we made a quality baseline education available to the world, for free. Today, we are one of the most widely... used medical education platforms globally, playing a key role in creating the next generation of health care professionals. Equipped with enhanced knowledge, reasoning skills, and empathy, this generation of doctors is improving the lives of millions of patients.

To help us pursue this mission, we are looking for a full-time Product Data Analyst to join our team. In this position, you will play an essential role in defining and putting into practice empirical methods that Product follows in decision making; you will be the main interface between the team and the data about our product, our users, and our market. Your mandate is to drive data literacy and enablement within the team.

Why You'll Love Working with Us

You'll be helping transform digital health care education, improving mobility and access for 300k+ users in 193 countries. Our team of talented employees and contractors is aligned to the same purpose and values, with the opportunity to bring our own unique strengths to our roles. Thanks to our welcoming company culture and comprehensive benefits, OnlineMedEd was ranked #5 Best Small Places to Work in 2022 by BuiltInAustin and one of the top Austin-based companies to work for overall.

What You'll Do
‚Ä¢ Be the primary liaison between Product and the Data Analytics Group and establish scalable processes around the use of data within the Product team
‚Ä¢ Independently analyze a variety of data sources (including customer tickets, NPS feedback, product utilization, etc.) to surface patterns around opportunities and propose priorities for improvement in the product
‚Ä¢ Define and formulate key success metrics and supporting dashboards for the Product team
‚Ä¢ Present important data and insights to the Product team as well as to other departments and senior executives
‚Ä¢ Support the discovery process (primary research, customer interviews) in coordination with product managers to define functional requirements of requested feature enhancements
‚Ä¢ Become an expert in understanding the specific user and customer motivations that shape solution design and prioritization
‚Ä¢ Be the subject matter expert on the data, data lifecycle, and data tools that inform Product decisions

Qualifications You'll Need
‚Ä¢ 2+ years of professional experience pulling and analyzing data to find insights about customer behavior
‚Ä¢ A data-informed and highly inquisitive mindset; interest in hypothesis testing, evaluation, and improvement
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated ability to work with basic data analysis tools and technologies (e.g. SQL, R, BI platforms)
‚Ä¢ Communication of data analysis to internal and external teams and stakeholders
‚Ä¢ Excellent written and verbal English skills
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to influence and deliver impact in a highly collaborative environment

Skills That Will Help
‚Ä¢ Prior experience in product management, customer success, or user experience/design
‚Ä¢ Prior experience using business intelligence platforms (e.g. Tableau, Sisense, Logi, Looker)
‚Ä¢ Prior experience with product utilization and tracking platforms (e.g Google Analytics, Pendo, Mixpanel, Heap, Segment...)
‚Ä¢ Experience in hybrid B2C and B2B SAAS businesses, and/or in higher education working directly with students
‚Ä¢ Thorough understanding of subscription-based business models

Our Benefits
‚Ä¢ Competitive compensation: $70,000- $90,000 depending on experience
‚Ä¢ Genuine flexibility in work:
- Location: Work in the Austin office, work from home, or opt-in to our hybrid model so you can experience the best of both.
- Hours: Work a schedule that makes sense for your life.
- Time off: Unlimited time off lets you celebrate, relax, recharge, recover, or travel the way that works best for you.
- Preferences: We provide funding to set up your home office space, plus you'll pick your own laptop, and own it after a year.
‚Ä¢ Enterprise-level health, dental, and vision insurance: OnlineMedEd covers 100% of the premium costs for employees, plus 80% or more of dependent premiums.
‚Ä¢ Health and fitness perks include ClassPass credits, a wellness stipend, and virtual coaching for mental health.

Our Values
‚Ä¢ Selflessness: The best results happen when we put the users first, the team second, and ourselves last.
‚Ä¢ Lifelong learning: Monthly Lunch and Learns, weekly presentations, funding for professional development, and 1:1 coaching provide frequent opportunities to learn and grow.
‚Ä¢ Accountability: Take responsibility for your day without being micromanaged. We're focused on doing great work; when and how you do it is up to you.
‚Ä¢ Transparency: We have an open-door policy and a no-blame culture. Salary ranges are transparent to foster pay equity. We value honest communication at every level of the company.
‚Ä¢ Excellence: Focus on being great. Use the equipment you want, take advantage of the flexibility of unlimited as-you-need-it time off, and work when and where it makes sense. We strive to set you up for success.

Diversity In Doing Good

OnlineMedEd is a purpose-driven organization focused on doing well by doing good. We recognize that doing good is best achieved by uniting the unique contributions of individuals with different backgrounds, cultures, perspectives, and experiences. Beyond our equal opportunity employer status, we are committed to recruiting, hiring, training, and supporting the professional development of diverse individuals who demonstrate outstanding performance and exemplify our core values

title: Business Intelligence Report Writer and Data Analyst
description:
How You'll Support Our Mission

Our vision is to provide our customers with meaningful information that leads to actionable outcomes, improving community health and safety through the power of data. As a member of ESO's platform engineering team, you will be collaborating with our prehospital and hospital product domains, business stakeholders, subject matter experts, and data engineers to... provide and support customers with data visualizations. The ideal candidate has a passion for data and learning new product technologies.

Reporting to the Manager of Data Platform, you will be part of our Platform Engineering team based in our Belcamp, Maryland office.

What You'll Be Doing - the day today

You will be responsible for executing our healthcare domain reporting needs; requirements gathering and development, data modeling, report building with front-end visualization tools (e.g., Sisense, PowerBI), and supporting and maintain our healthcare reporting needs. You know how to interpret a stakeholder need, translate it into data and technical reporting requirements. You consistently assess the value/why behind any action. You believe in our mission. You enjoy creative problem solving and learning new skills. You enjoy collaboration and getting first-hand feedback from cross-product domain owners.
‚Ä¢ Make our customers' reporting experience as amazing as possible using your understanding of data analysis and visualization
‚Ä¢ Gather reporting requirements from a variety of input streams: including advisory groups, product domain owners, and data engineers
‚Ä¢ Creates and maintains data documentation across healthcare products being supported including ongoing changes or amendments to data specifications and schema.
‚Ä¢ Play multiple roles including data discovery, analysis, and specifying changes to how reports and dashboards create and maintain information
‚Ä¢ Conducts root cause analysis on data issues throughout the life cycle of the data platform and triages data issues reported by users in reporting production systems.

Who You Are - Some of the essential things required to be successful in the role:
‚Ä¢ 2+ experience in healthcare data storage, analysis, and visualization using BI tools such as Sisense, PowerBI, or Qlik
‚Ä¢ Experience with maintaining and supporting cross-product SQL relational data models
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to multi-task and coordinate with multiple teams
‚Ä¢ History of working closely with product and technology teams and ability to work collaboratively to get results
‚Ä¢ Strong communication skills, both written and spoken
‚Ä¢ Passionate for transforming data into meaningful information and actionable outcomes

Who You Are - the desirables (It's a plus if you have):
‚Ä¢ Real-life clinical experience
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in SQL including complex queries and schema development
‚Ä¢ Experience developing visualizations using open-source libraries such as D3.JS

title: Data Analyst
description:
Health Informatics Spec II

The Data Analyst within the IIS Interoperability Group performs routine (journey-level) data analysis work as assigned by the IIS Interoperability Post Production Team manager. Work involves data analysis and reporting of immunization data and refining analytical processes in support of Texas' Immunization programs which includes the Texas Vaccines for Children (TVFC... and Adult Safety Net (ASN). Consults and provides expert technical assistance and guidance to program staff within the DSHS central and regional offices, local health departments, other governmental agencies, Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), and other stakeholders. Recommends and develops processes for implementing, tracking, reporting, and analysis of Texas immunization data. Manages data projects relevant to the Immunization Section and the IIS Interoperability Group. Works under general supervision with limited latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgement.

Essential Job Functions:
Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned.

(40%) Analyzes, identifies, and interprets data electronically reported to the Texas Immunization Registry. This includes the identification of programmatic risks originating from data quality issues including errors, anomalies, inconsistencies, trends, and outliers identified during analysis. Suggests programmatic improvements to address gaps identified during analysis. Recommends and develops processes for implementing, tracking, reporting, and analysis of Texas immunization data.

(25%) Creates, streamlines, and automates vaccine data analysis reports and tools which assist in the oversight of vaccines disseminated through the TVFC and ASN programs. Provides consultative guidance and technical assistance to staff in the integration of new methods to accomplish necessary tasks using the federal and state immunization systems.

(20%) Communicates with other immunization stakeholders including regional and local entities as well as Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) personnel to provide, exchange, or verify information, answer inquiries, address issues, or resolve problems. This may include the creation and presentation of findings. Manages data projects as assigned by the IIS Interoperability Director and provides routine written and verbal status reports on projects.

(10%) Reviews and develops policies and procedures regarding data and analysis to ensure compliance with programmatic and operational goals. May develop recommendations to improve collection of data.

(5%) Other duties as assigned include but are not limited to actively participating and/or serving in a supporting role to meet the agency's obligation for disaster response and/or recovery of Continuity of Operations (COOP) activation. Such participation may require an alternative shift pattern assignment and/or location.

Knowledge Skills Abilities:
Extensive PC skills including Microsoft Word, Excel (including VBA), Access, PowerPoint, Outlook, SQL, SAS, and other relevant software applications.
Knowledge of database management, data analysis, and reporting.
Knowledge of business analysis.
Knowledge of project management standards and techniques.

Skill in developing written materials and training.
Skill in developing electronic reports from databases.
Skill in responding to customer inquiries and handling difficult customers in a tactful manner.
Skill in arithmetic, English grammar, and spelling.
Skill in supervising, leading and training others.

Ability to gather and analyze data and facts, and to devise solutions to problems.
Ability to communicate processes and procedures clearly and effectively to others.
Ability to use independent judgment and to plan, organize and coordinate work assignments to meet deadlines.
Ability to establish effective working relationships with supervisory personnel and co-workers.
Ability to effectively communicate (both orally and in writing) processes and procedures.
Ability to promote effective communication between technical and non-technical staff.
Ability to analyze business needs, systems and procedures.
Ability to initiate plans, organize work and make decisions with minimal supervision.
Ability to work effectively with others.

Registration or Licensure Requirements:

Initial Selection Criteria:
1. Graduation from an accredited four-year College or university required, with major course work relevant to the position's responsibilities is preferred.
2. At least four years of relevant employment experience may be substituted for education
3. Experience using Microsoft Word, Excel (including VBA), Access, PowerPoint, Outlook, SQL, SAS, or other relevant software applications.
4. Experience conducting data and business analysis.

Additional Information:
Must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship. Applicants selected for an interview will be required to complete an in-basket exercise. Full salary range may not be offered due to budget limitations.

MOS Code:
70D,230X,41AX

title: Accountant V-VII (Chief Accountant)
description:
General Description

Performs highly advanced accounting work and may assign, and/or supervise the work of others. Work involves preparing financial analyses, budgets and reports; establishing, improving, and maintaining accounting systems, procedures, and controls; and processing, auditing, and reconciling payroll. Work is performed under the general direction of the Chief Financial Officer with... extensive latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.

General Duties and Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Ensures compliance with State laws and regulations pertaining to financial reporting, budget, travel, payroll, and historical document management.
‚Ä¢ Develops methods for the control of cash receipts, deposits, and disbursements; the purchase of services, supplies, and equipment; and the documentation of claims for payment.
‚Ä¢ Audits and approves payroll vouchers, purchase vouchers, travel vouchers, journal entries, and interagency transfers.
‚Ä¢ Creates, monitors, and maintains accounting and funding structures using the Centralized Accounting and Payroll/Personnel System (CAPPS) Financials and HR/Payroll, and the Uniform Statewide Accounting System (USAS).
‚Ä¢ Reconciles revenues and expenditures monthly and researches and records proper adjusting entries prior to the preparation of monthly financial statements.
‚Ä¢ Reviews revenues and expenditures for reasonableness and accuracy.
‚Ä¢ Prepares and coordinates the planning, development, and submission of the Department‚Äôs annual financial report in accordance with Governmental Accounting Standards Board and Office of the Comptroller of Public Accounts requirements.
‚Ä¢ Prepares and coordinates the planning, development, and submission of the Department‚Äôs Annual Non-Financial Report in accordance with the Governor‚Äôs Office requirements.
‚Ä¢ Prepares and reviews general ledger accounting entries and reconciliation of financial transactions.
‚Ä¢ Prepares and transmits reports including the FTE report, Quarterly Measures Report, and Semi- Annual Security Verification report.
‚Ä¢ Reviews and approves all operating and travel vouchers, deposits, and journal entries.
‚Ä¢ Reviews and mails all 1099s at the end of the calendar year.
‚Ä¢ Assists with internal and external audit inquiries.
‚Ä¢ Assists in the preparation of legislative fiscal notes and the Department‚Äôs annual operating budget.
‚Ä¢ Acts as the Department‚Äôs Security Officer granting access to all Comptroller applications.
‚Ä¢ Monitors and oversees the daily activities of accounting personnel relating to travel, payroll, accounts payable, and accounts receivable.
‚Ä¢ Performs other duties as assigned.

Required Minimum Qualifications:

Experience and Education

Accountant V
‚Ä¢ Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major course work in accounting, finance, management, business administration, or related field is required. Each year of related State of Texas experience may be substituted for education on a year-for-year basis, up to four years.
‚Ä¢ Four years of experience in financial administration and fiscal accounting, including experience in State of Texas accounting, budgeting, and reporting.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of State laws pertaining to public funds, governmental finance, and the use of electronic accounting equipment.
‚Ä¢ Experience using CAPPS Financials and HR/Payroll, USAS, and Uniform Statewide Payroll/Personnel System (USPS).

Accountant VI
‚Ä¢ Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major course work in accounting, finance, management, business administration, or related field is required. Each year of related State of Texas experience may be substituted for education on a year-for-year basis, up to four years.
‚Ä¢ Five years of experience in financial administration and fiscal accounting, including experience in State of Texas accounting, budgeting, and reporting.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of State laws pertaining to public funds, governmental finance, and the use of electronic accounting equipment.
‚Ä¢ Experience using CAPPS Financials and HR/Payroll, USAS, and Uniform Statewide Payroll/Personnel System (USPS).

Accountant VII
‚Ä¢ Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major course work in accounting, finance, management, business administration, or related field is required. Each year of related State of Texas experience may be substituted for education on a year-for-year basis, up to four years.
‚Ä¢ Six years of experience in financial administration and fiscal accounting, including experience in State of Texas accounting, budgeting, and reporting.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of State laws pertaining to public funds, governmental finance, and the use of electronic accounting equipment.
‚Ä¢ Experience using CAPPS Financials and HR/Payroll, USAS, and Uniform Statewide Payroll/Personnel System (USPS).

Preferred Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Experience in the supervision of personnel
‚Ä¢ Experience in State of Texas property accounting and purchasing.

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of financial administration, budget control and fiscal accounting.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of governmental accounting, budget control methods, policies and procedures and laws and regulations pertaining to fiscal operations.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Generally Accepted According Principles (GAAP) and ability to apply.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of purchasing methods and procedures.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of financial reporting, required.
‚Ä¢ Ability to direct accounting programs.
‚Ä¢ Ability to interpret laws and regulations to apply accounting theory.
‚Ä¢ Ability to work accurately with numerical detail.
‚Ä¢ Ability to analyze, consolidate, and interpret accounting data.
‚Ä¢ Ability to work effectively and cooperatively with a variety of individuals and groups.
‚Ä¢ Ability to read and interpret financial statements.
‚Ä¢ Ability to budget funds and set up accounting and internal control systems.
‚Ä¢ Ability to train and supervise staff.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in operating personal computers using Microsoft applications to include Access, Excel and Word.
‚Ä¢ Ability to direct and supervise others, direct accounting programs, budget funds, set up accounting systems, understand and interpret laws and regulations and interpret and apply complex accounting theory.
‚Ä¢ Above average skills in written and verbal communication.

Physical and Cognitive Requirements:

The physical demands described here are represented of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions:

This position requires the incumbent to primarily perform sedentary office work; however, mobility (standing and walking) is routinely required to carry out some duties. It requires extensive computer, copiers, printers, telephone and client/customer contact. The job also requires normal cognitive abilities requiring the ability to learn, recall, and apply certain practices and policies. It requires the stamina to maintain attention to detail despite interruptions. Marginal or corrected visual, speech and auditory requirements are required for reading printed materials and computer screens and communicating with internal and external customers.
‚Ä¢ Regular and punctual attendance.
‚Ä¢ Frequent use of personal computer, copiers, printers, and telephones.
‚Ä¢ Frequent sitting.
‚Ä¢ Frequent work under stress, as a team member, and in direct contact with others.
‚Ä¢ Travel less than 5% with possible overnight stays.

Overtime may be required with or without notice.
