‚Ä¢ Experience researching and presenting new and/or existing accounting standards.
‚Ä¢ Ability to travel to more than one work location.

Duties, Functions And Responsibilities

Essential duties and functions, pursuant to the Americans with Disabilities Act, may include the following. Other related duties may be assigned.

Provides coordination and oversees the collections of revenue and/or processing of customer payments; analysis, and clearing of delinquent accounts; notifying customers of insufficient payments; calculating/assessing delinquent fines/fees, etc. Prepares complex financial statements for external reporting or financial reports by preparing and/or overseeing the preparation of complex balance sheets, income statements, cash flow statements, and reports; collecting, analyzing, and summarizing general ledger account information and trends; applying advanced skills and knowledge of accounting and reporting requirements of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, GAAP . Prepares audit work papers for annual external audit or special audit by preparing, reviewing, and/or overseeing the preparation of complex supporting work papers for assigned area(s); providing explanations of City policy and procedures and responding to auditor questions and requests for information in a timely and accurate manner. Carries out complex projects by researching new accounting standards and related reporting/ information requirements, organizing/summarizing research results, and presenting recommendations to management for timely implementation in the City's Comprehensive Annual Financial Report. Maintains accounting ledgers by posting/reviewing and/or approving the posting of account transactions; ensuring transactions are processed in accordance with GAAP , City policy, applicable laws and regulations, and sound business practices. Leads reconciliation of general ledger and/or bank accounts and resolves account discrepancies by reconciling and/or reviewing the reconciliation of statements and transactions and investigating documentation; issuing stop payments, payments, or adjustments, and by facilitating discrepancy resolutions for other accounting staff members. Assists departments and other internal or external customers by drafting procedural, financial, and/or other information and guidance with automated or manual accounting systems. Provides guidance and direction through the review of asset, liability, inventory, and/or capital accounting entries as prepared by internal/ external department staff, and provides City-wide accounting software training or proctors Continuing Professional Education ( CPE ) classes. Assesses internal accounting controls for effectiveness; presents procedural recommendations to management; maintains financial security by documenting the established internal accounting controls.

Responsibilities- Supervision And/or Leadership Exercised
‚Ä¢ Provide leadership, work assignments, evaluation, training, and guidance to others.

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities

Must possess required knowledge, skills, abilities, and experience and be able to explain and demonstrate, with or without reasonable accommodations, that the essential functions of the job can be performed.
‚Ä¢ Advanced knowledge of internal control systems.
‚Ä¢ Advanced knowledge of financial reporting in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles, GAAP .
‚Ä¢ Advanced knowledge of financial reporting concepts and preferred business practices.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of manual and automated financial systems.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of the preparation process of complex financial statements and reports in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles.
‚Ä¢ Skill in classifying complex fiscal data and compiling fund level statements and reports
‚Ä¢ Skill in effective verbal and written communications.
‚Ä¢ Skill in managing and processing large volumes of financial transaction data.
‚Ä¢ Skill in analyzing and interpreting financial records.
‚Ä¢ Skill in utilizing personal computer.
‚Ä¢ Skill in designing and maintaining complex spreadsheets and data bases utilizing word processing software.
‚Ä¢ Ability to prepare accurate and complex financial reports and statements.
‚Ä¢ Ability to resolve problems or situations requiring the exercise of good judgement.
‚Ä¢ Ability to establish and maintain good working relationships with other City employees and the public

Criminal Background Investigation This position has been approved for a Criminal Background Investigation.

EEO/ADA

City of Austin is committed to compliance with the American Disabilities Act. If you require reasonable accommodation during the application process or have a question regarding an essential job function, please call (512) 974-3210 or TTY (512) 974-2445.

The City of Austin will not discriminate against any applicant or employee based on race, creed, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, age, religion, veteran status, disability, or sexual orientation. In addition, the City will not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of an individual's AIDS , AIDS Related Complex, or HIV status; nor will the City discriminate against individuals who are perceived to be at risk of HIV infection, or who associate with individuals who are believed to be at risk.

title: Accountant
description:
Accountant

Looking to join a team at the forefront of travel technology development? Vrbo, an Expedia Group brand is hiring for a motivated, high energy Accountant reporting to the Accounting Senior Manager in its Austin, Texas headquarters. We are looking for an employee that is eager to learn and thrives in a fast-paced data-driven environment. Join our fantastic team and take advantage of the... opportunity to partner with great minds at a phenomenal company!

Our team is part of the larger Global Finance Organization and you will have direct responsibility for reconciling global e-commerce payment accounts and reconciling cash activity. You will drive monthly and quarterly close activities related to cash activity, analyze high volumes of transactional data and manage auditor requests.

To be successful, you will be a high-energy, hands-on individual that can work independently and provide accounting process improvement expertise in support of the company's revenue drivers and initiatives. We strive to perform our role at the highest levels and serve as a resource for our company to lean on.

What you'll do:
‚Ä¢ Prepare monthly journal entries and account reconciliations to support the close process
‚Ä¢ Research and resolve exceptions between the credit card processor, accounting system, and bank statements
‚Ä¢ Manage and organize large amounts of data in order to isolate and solve problems
‚Ä¢ Coordinate and improve global cash matching processes
‚Ä¢ Streamline systems and reporting tools to ensure efficient and accurate recording and proper classification of liabilities and expenses
‚Ä¢ Build connections to help drive understanding of the accounting processes and assist with various requests
‚Ä¢ Work independently to prepare audit PBC's and coordinate external auditor requests as needed

Who you are:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's in Accounting or related field; or Equivalent related professional experience
‚Ä¢ 2-4 years of accounting experience. A background at a large growth oriented international organization or high-tech company is a plus
‚Ä¢ Prior experience with high volume transactional revenue systems and data analysis required
‚Ä¢ Experience with balance sheet reconciliations and journal entries
‚Ä¢ A curious attitude that is always seeking to understand the finer details of everything
‚Ä¢ Intermediate to advanced Excel skills and a strong understanding of Business Objects, Blackline, Oracle or other similar accounting tools
‚Ä¢ Able to multi-task and manage priorities in a fast-paced environment

At Expedia Group, we believe in bringing people together and creating an inclusive workplace where everyone belongs and can do their best work. We care about our employees' safety and wellbeing, so we're requiring new hires in the U.S. to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and present acceptable proof of vaccination before their start date as a condition of employment. Expedia Group (NASDAQ: EXPE) powers travel for everyone, everywhere through our global platform. We provide industry-leading technology solutions to fuel partner growth and success, while facilitating memorable experiences for travelers. title: Project Accountant (Real Estate)
description:
Job Description

Project Accountant...

Legend Communities, Lakeway TX

Responsibilities:

The Project Accountant is responsible for various aspects of accounts payable, accounting, and record maintenance as it relates to real estate, construction, property management, home building, and/or land development projects, including receiving and processing vendor invoices, credit card charges, subcontractor pay estimates, deposits and other items in a privately owned, multi-entity environment. Coordination with various disciplines including accounting, purchasing, sales, land development and construction.

Essential Duties:
‚Ä¢ Sort and distribute incoming documents for multi-entity environment
‚Ä¢ Match incoming invoices to P.O.‚Äôs, research and clear variances
‚Ä¢ Process subcontractor pay estimates including tracking to contract, change orders and lien waivers
‚Ä¢ Process check runs and check requests
‚Ä¢ Review all invoices and pay estimates for appropriate documentation
‚Ä¢ Coordinate and track approvals prior to payment
‚Ä¢ Prepare monthly unit construction loan draw requests
‚Ä¢ Monitor subcontractor compliance including insurance certificates and lien wavers
‚Ä¢ Assist Project Controller and Purchasing department with construction contract administration
‚Ä¢ Audit and process credit card charges and bills
‚Ä¢ Match invoices to checks, obtain all signatures for checks and distribute checks
‚Ä¢ 1099 preparation, distribution, and file maintenance
‚Ä¢ Respond to vendor inquiries
‚Ä¢ Respond to internal management and departmental inquiries
‚Ä¢ Reconcile vendor statements, research and correct discrepancies
‚Ä¢ Assist in periodic monthly, quarterly and yearly closings
‚Ä¢ Maintain files and documentation thoroughly and accurately, in accordance with policies and processes
‚Ä¢ Prepare or assist with bank reconciliations
‚Ä¢ Prepare or assist with invoicing customers and/or tenants, process deposits
‚Ä¢ May have "full charge" accounting and reporting responsibility where needed or qualified

Job Requirements:
‚Ä¢ 2+ years of experience in Accounts Payable or Accounting
‚Ä¢ Accounting coursework or associates degree in accounting preferred; equivalent proven experience will be considered; Bachelor's Degree in accounting a plus but not required
‚Ä¢ Experience with residential construction or home building company is a plus
‚Ä¢ Recent advanced QuickBooks experience to include accounts payable, journal entries, basic report generation, and bank reconciliations
‚Ä¢ Recent ECi MarkSystems software experience a plus
‚Ä¢ Intermediate to advanced skills in Excel, Word and Outlook desired
‚Ä¢ Task-oriented with proven abilities to manage deadlines, organize, prioritize multiple tasks, and produce quality and accurate work often in a fast-paced environment
‚Ä¢ Excellent verbal and written communicator, strong interpersonal skills, ability to work with various departments, disciplines and staff levels
‚Ä¢ Handle multiple projects and accounting software (QuickBooks and ECi Mark Systems)
‚Ä¢ Strong desire to learn and grow
‚Ä¢ Work with minimal supervision, take pride and ownership of work

Important Notes:
‚Ä¢ If you are kind, reliable, responsible, smart and flexible, and willing to work in the office, you could fit in great here and we would love to meet you!
‚Ä¢ If you are looking for a highly structured ‚Äúcorporate‚Äù environment with lots of rules and consistent pace, or you desire to work remotely, you will probably not fit in here and need not apply.

For eligible employees:

description:

We have a vacancy of General Ledger Accountant in our company, American Campus Communities. This vacancy is based in 12700 Hill Country Blvd Austin TX 78738. Please go through the job detail mentioned below...

URL Expiry: 2022-04-14

Job Detail

We are looking for a General Ledger Accountant to join our Austin office. The successful candidate will play an integral role in ensuring the timely production of accurate financial statements by applying generally accepted accounting principles and specific company procedures to the maintenance of balance sheet reconciliations for specific general ledger accounts across a multitude of entities. In addition, the General Ledger Accountant will actively collaborate with other team members to identify areas for process improvement and will have an opportunity to be a problem solver. This position requires a solid understanding of all aspects of accounting as well as a high degree of accuracy and strong attention to detail.

American Campus Communities is the nation‚Äôs largest owner, operator, and manager of premier student housing facilities. Enjoy a fun, team-oriented work environment and casual dress code at a large publicly-traded company with competitive benefits.

Critical & Essential Duties and Responsibilities (other duties be assigned):
‚Ä¢ Monthly preparation of key balance sheet account reconciliations for large portfolio of properties, including workpaper and journal entry creation
‚Ä¢ Provide audit support requests to both internal and external auditors
‚Ä¢ Understand and comply with GAAP, Sarbanes Oxley, and other related policies and procedures
‚Ä¢ Design and creation of new balance sheet account reconciliation as well as improvement of existing reconciliations
‚Ä¢ Close coordination and communication with Property Accounting team and other stakeholders to research, analyze and explain trends and variances
‚Ä¢ Prepare additional reports and analysis as required by auditors, lenders, and joint venture partners

‚Ä¢ Assist operational staff and management with explanations of variances from budget
‚Ä¢ Perform various duties as assigned by management including special projects, ad hoc reporting, cross train with other employees for back-up coverage and assist in accounting support

We are passionate about our work and building community.
‚Ä¢ Our people are devoted to a culture of inclusion, diversity, and equality in the workplace and our communities. We are committed to intentionally executing an evolving set of goals specific to inclusion, diversity, and accountability, driven by empathetic leadership and embraced by all.
‚Ä¢ The core of American Campus culture involves everyone being fully invested in everything that we do down to picking up the smallest piece of trash. No matter their position or duration at any given property, everyone picks up trash because we take pride in our community.
‚Ä¢ Serve as an American Campus representative and liaison in all interactions.

‚Ä¢ Minimum of 2 ‚Äì 3 years of audit or accounting experience required
‚Ä¢ Strong Microsoft Excel skills (Excel) a must, MRI experience a plus
‚Ä¢ Real estate experience a plus
‚Ä¢ Excellent oral and written communication skills
‚Ä¢ Independent, self-starter, team player
‚Ä¢ Ability to deliver excellent customer service at all levels of the organization and with external partners
‚Ä¢ Possess strong organizational, time management and project management skills with a demonstrated ability to work both independently and within a team environment
‚Ä¢ Exhibit a high level of professionalism and excellent interpersonal skills
‚Ä¢ Strong relationship-building ability, proactive, results-oriented, and resourceful
‚Ä¢ Ability to meet deadlines without compromising accuracy, excellent product quality and attention to detail

description:

title: Receptionist
description:
Overview

Make Lives Better Including Your Own...

The happiness of those we serve is dependent on the happiness of our associates, so you‚Äôll receive competitive compensation and a benefits package with additional perks designed to make you smile. The work you do will be challenging yet rewarding. But you‚Äôll earn more than a paycheck; you can enjoy opportunities to grow your career, as well as ongoing programs catered to your health, financial, mental, and emotional needs. Most of all, we believe you can find purpose, meaning, and the chance to be a part of something bigger than yourself.

Veterans, transitioning active duty military personnel, and military spouses are encouraged to apply.

We believe that in order to best serve our residents and patients, we need to first serve our associates. One way we do that is through our benefits. Our offerings include, but are not limited to:

Full-time and part-time associate benefits:

¬∑ 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan

¬∑ Benefit plan package

¬∑ Voluntary STD and LTD

Please note, Brookdale has adopted a policy requiring all associates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, subject to limited exemptions based on medical conditions, sincerely held religious beliefs, or applicable state laws and regulations.

Responsibilities

Are you outgoing and someone who loves interacting with people on a daily basis? Then Brookdale‚Äôs Receptionist job is for you! Our Receptionists greet visitors, answer phones, and are the face and voice of our communities. In this role, you will answer questions and help our senior residents and guests in a professional, pleasant and courteous manner. Become part of our family, grow your skills and career, and have the satisfaction of helping make seniors‚Äô lives brighter every day.

Qualifications

What it takes to be a Receptionist at Brookdale:

Receptionists greet all visitors entering the community, answer questions, ensure visitors sign guest sheets, and answer/direct phone calls to the proper residents and staff. Our Receptionists sort, deliver and collect incoming/outgoing community and resident mail, and may be asked to do basic office/clerical functions, and maintain visitor logs. You may also respond to resident emergencies by calling appropriate internal and external parties based on community protocol.

Brookdale is an equal opportunity employer and a drug-free workplace

This position is ideal for those who wish to pursue a career in health care. This is a fast-paced role that calls for the ability to multitask , think on your feet and work independently. title: Content Strategist
description:
Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets... talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities
Mission: The content director brings the voices of our customers and partners into our narratives and assets. He or she helps teams write effective value propositions and compelling stories, develops concepts (and tests them). Content directors lead key partnerships with agencies, publishers, and production companies. They plan for assets and SEO in collaboration with campaign teams and write input and asset briefs to ensure clear and consistent creative vision. They create original content, audit existing content, and measure content performance in alignment with our overarching goal: Make Less Matter More.

Job description: Content marketers are responsible for driving content strategy from organic search through purchase. We are responsible for excellent storytelling, bringing IBM brand and product stories to life in ways that capture our customers‚Äô, partners‚Äô, and prospects‚Äô imagination. Content marketers are:
‚Ä¢ The editorial voice for a squad, providing guidance for the most effective tone and formats to deliver our messages, grounded in data.
‚Ä¢ Respected by cross-functional peers for their ability to find the most compelling aspects of our technology and build consensus around content to support it.
‚Ä¢ Audience and market experts who understand the right formats for the right audiences.
‚Ä¢ Creates input and asset briefs to build internal consensus across all teams and channels and to drive consistency, including via repeatable formats.
‚Ä¢ Constantly works to build creative and technical skills to adopt the most effective new and repeatable formats for our content.
Key responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Creative stewards, leading teams to develop new ideas, collaborate on content and briefs, share best practices, review the content calendar and edit content.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with Product and Performance to ensure we get to a great brief and effective distribution plans
‚Ä¢ Manage agencies from a creative POV and pick the best creation model
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with Digital on end-to-end content experiences
‚Ä¢ Review and approve all content before it goes live
‚Ä¢ Ensures Geos have insight into all content plans and facilitates globalization of assets.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
3+ years of experience:
‚Ä¢ Writing effective value propositions and compelling stories, developing concepts (and testing them).
‚Ä¢ Planning for assets and SEO in collaboration with campaign teams and write input and asset briefs to ensure clear and consistent creative vision.
‚Ä¢ Creating original content, auditing existing content, and measuring content performance.
‚Ä¢ Driving content strategy from organic search through purchase.

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
See Required Skills

title: Content Strategist
description:
Responsibilities

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices, including Mountain View, Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo...

TikTok's SMB team aims to help businesses and brands of all sizes unleash their creative side, connect with our audience, or perhaps be discovered! From designing scaled sales and service delivery programs to ensuring our customers have best-in-class tools and products at their fingertips, our SMB team combines operational expertise with a customer-centric mindset to help businesses achieve their marketing goals on TikTok no matter how big or small.

The Global Senior Content Strategist will drive growth marketing efforts across our critical SMB solutions. Responsibilities include leading and developing large-scale campaigns from idea to execution and creating frameworks that measure business performance results. The idea candidate blends expertise in B2B growth marketing, performance marketing, content development, SEO, and social media (paid and organic).

Responsibilities

- Develop content and design strategy for SMB products and feature GTM launches and marketing campaigns (awareness, activation, retention). Own communication of content strategies and timelines to global XFN partner teams.

- Write clear, compelling copy for various content types and channels, including across the entire buyer journey to different personas, verticals, and communication touchpoints. Ensure consistency of brand voice throughout all of our communication touchpoints.

- Work with the Analytics team to conduct A/B copy testing, monitor content performance, and translate into clear observations and actionable steps to optimize future content efforts/campaigns. Share learnings with XFN stakeholders.

- Lead weekly/biweekly touch-base calls with XFN stakeholders to align current and upcoming campaigns/projects.

Qualifications

- 8+ years in managing large-scale campaigns across diversified channels (paid, organic, web, social media, influence marketing, etc.) environments; strong experience writing for business audiences at all levels and functions.

- A deep understanding of the Small & Medium Businesses industry.

- Comfortable in leading and collaborating with cross-functional teams to define goals, strategies, and critical messages.

- Strong results orientation in dynamic, high-growth, fast-paced environments with a proven track record of delivering high-priority projects with tight deadlines and cross-functional dependencies.

- Strong analytical skills and a proven record of asking tough questions that lead to smart insights.

- Knowledgeable about TikTok marketing best practices and trends.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe, and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity but should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or accommodation, please reach out to us at usrc@tiktok.com

title: Content Strategist
description:
3Q Digital is leading the disruption of the growth marketing industry by turning our clients into market leaders and household names across the B2C, B2B, ecommerce, and FinTech verticals. We're independent and values-driven, and the way we work reflects our Silicon Valley roots: we're relentless, curious, and accept no limits in driving growth for our clients and each other.

We offer full... marketing services including SEM, SEO, social advertising, display, mobile, analytics, CRO, creative, and business strategy. We build and execute strategies to enable clients and our own internal teams to capitalize on opportunities, break through barriers to growth, and lead our respective fields.

We are committed to building and sustaining an environment where everyone feels psychologically safe and valued. We seek frequent, open feedback from our team and we offer company-wide training and regular, open discussions on diversity, equity, inclusion and other social issues.

3Q offers employees flexibility with remote, hybrid, and in-office options (depending on team/location).

About You

The Content Strategist will work on a range of clients in support of our broader SEO team to contribute to and evolve our Content Marketing service. You will help lead and develop our Content Marketing strategies, provide content ideation to the SEO account team, and conduct outreach to media publishers to keep our clients relevant within their verticals.

You have a passion for digital marketing and a keen eye for detail. If you're a grammar savant that can also digest numbers and data to find actionable insights, please apply.

You'll be responsible for:
‚Ä¢ Conceptualizing and executing on varied content assets, including longform editorial, infographics, whitepapers, and eBooks, for clients across a wide array of industries
‚Ä¢ Collaborating with the SEO team to identify keyword & content strategy, creating content roadmaps that follow SEO best practices
‚Ä¢ Reviewing and edit freelance writer work, providing ultimate signoff on client assets before delivery
‚Ä¢ Conceptualize creative assets to complement editorial content and collaborate with design team to oversee completion
‚Ä¢ Deliver all completed work to SEO Strategists and clients, adhering to strict guidelines
‚Ä¢ Monitor the quality of all content, ensuring every asset aligns with client brand and messaging guidelines
‚Ä¢ Manage client relationships via email, Slack, and Zoom
‚Ä¢ Lead calls when necessary

You'll need to have:
‚Ä¢ A minimum of four (4) years of relevant work experience with proven track record of creating compelling editorial content
‚Ä¢ Exemplary writing and editing skills
‚Ä¢ Exemplary time management skills
‚Ä¢ Effective communication and problem solving skills as it relates to collaboration
‚Ä¢ Ability to transform complex data and subject matter into concise, engaging copy
‚Ä¢ A deep understanding of search engine optimized B2C and B2B content
‚Ä¢ Ability to contribute clear, actionable ideas to improve content performance
‚Ä¢ Self-driven and capable of handling fast-paced workload with enthusiasm
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated experience with managing editorial workflow calendars
‚Ä¢ Experience publishing content through CMS platforms
‚Ä¢ Experience conceptualizing and coordinating creative assets

About Us

3Q's unique culture is developed and nurtured by our fantastic people and our core values:

Be Inclusive. We value everyone's ideas and opinions and commit to building a psychologically safe environment to foster them. Our hiring, communications, and promotions practices reflect our belief that diverse perspectives and equitable and inclusive practices continue to push us and our clients to find new ways to lead.

Act for the Greater Good. We lead with empathy and teamwork. During good times and bad, we are committed to supporting each other, our clients, and our communities.

Own It. We are accountable: to ourselves, to our teams, to our clients. We are proactive, we communicate clearly, and we follow through.

Accept No Limits. We are intellectually curious and resourceful. We constantly challenge the status quo to find or develop innovations that drive breakthrough opportunities for our teams and our clients.

We are a collaborative, open-door, best-idea-wins environment that fosters personal and company growth and has fun doing it. We promote work/life balance and encourage constant learning by offering unparalleled training, mentorship, and development for career progression. And perhaps the best, most fundamental part of our culture: authenticity.
‚Ä¢ AdAge Best Places to Work 2020, 2021 and 2022
‚Ä¢ One of Inc.'s Best Places to Work in 2019
‚Ä¢ Winner of the 2019 US Search Diversity, Inclusion and Equality Award
‚Ä¢ Competitive compensation
‚Ä¢ Full benefits including health, dental, vision, a 401K plan and company match, and paid parental leave
‚Ä¢ Flexible PTO
‚Ä¢ Flexible work-from-home policy
‚Ä¢ Volunteer opportunities, team retreats, and lunch seminars

3Q Digital's top priority is the health and safety of our employees, their families and the communities where they live and work. As part of our commitment to health and safety, we require all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 if they choose to come in to a 3Q office, attend company events, and/or work with peers in-person at any site. 3Q Digital offers a reasonable accommodation process for individuals who are unable to meet our vaccination requirement due to a disability, medical condition or sincerely held religious belief.

3Q Digital is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, committed to evaluating all qualified candidates regardless of gender, gender identity, race, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Furthermore, we believe optimal results come from operating a meritocracy built upon diversity of thought and background and absolutely devoid of discrimination and hate speech. We do everything in our power, including strict adherence to an anti-harassment policy, to make 3Q an inclusive, psychologically safe organization whose employees feel comfortable respectfully sharing their thoughts with each other and our leadership. Our training and mentorship programs help make sure all employees have an equal opportunity to grow and excel

title: Content Strategist III
description:
Content Strategist III

Are you a versatile content strategy leader who gets excited about solving challenging customer service problems at an enterprise-scale? Do you want to use your skills to help agents get quick, useful answers to their questions? Do you thrive when handling ambiguity and change? Then let's talk about this opportunity to join the Conversation Platform and Customer Experience... Operations Content Strategy Team at Expedia Group!

We would love to see an example of your expertise, style, and creativity.

Please provide a link to your portfolio or attach samples, as applications without portfolios will not be considered.

We're redefining our traveler and agent experiences with state-of-the-art artificial intelligence and machine learning in mind. We put the traveler first and use data to drive our decisions. As part of our team, you'll partner across disciplines (UX and LX Designers, Product Managers, Engineering, and others) to co-create simple, intuitive, useful, and cohesive knowledge product experiences and narratives that are context-aware, human, and delightful. You'll define the content (for the knowledge base, email, and more) that helps users get the right help information at the right time. You'll solve for the presentation of knowledge and learning product content in the experience, as well as the structure that delivers that content.

Who you are:
‚Ä¢ You're a blend of people leader, storyteller, UX writer, and content designer
‚Ä¢ You know how to identify user needs and find the right content to meet those needs
‚Ä¢ You use logic, data, research, and empathy for your user to inform your choices and can back up your recommendations with solid reasoning
‚Ä¢ You love competitive analysis and are enthusiastic about creating cohesive content strategies
‚Ä¢ You live and breathe everything content strategy and love technology
‚Ä¢ You're immersed in UX and LX process: you aren't looking for editorial content creation, social media strategy, or content marketing role
‚Ä¢ You're nimble: you pivot quickly when priorities shift, or requirements change
‚Ä¢ You're a strong communicator and understand the role content plays in design and performance
‚Ä¢ You advocate for solutions that balance the needs of agents and travelers with business objectives
‚Ä¢ You have an eye for details and know the difference between good and bad content
‚Ä¢ You're biased to action, able to prioritize and consistently meet deadlines
‚Ä¢ You're an excellent project manager: you stay on top of your deliverables and get things done

What you will do:
‚Ä¢ Audit, analyze, structure, create, and present content independently using established frameworks, and coach a small team to do the same
‚Ä¢ Consistently communicate strategy and team direction to team and stakeholders
‚Ä¢ Actively encourage team members to seek diverse feedback on agent experience work
‚Ä¢ Help team members prioritize and link daily work to broader objectives and manage workloads to ensure all team members are fully deployed and skills are matched to the work requirements
‚Ä¢ Bring a content strategy view to define and refine the Knowledge Graph which is the brains behind the ML
‚Ä¢ Focus increasingly on content problems across systems and product areas
‚Ä¢ Work reciprocally with fellow content strategists as well as designers, engineers, product managers, and many others to conceptualize content-focused experiences and bring your work to life
‚Ä¢ Assess competitor content and user experiences for content coverage, quality, gaps, and emerging industry and content trends
‚Ä¢ Identify content needs and gaps across multiple stages of the user journey, and create content to address those gaps
‚Ä¢ Communicate your findings, recommendations, and content specifications through user scenarios, presentations, comps, prototypes, and style guides
‚Ä¢ Describe and present your methods, explorations, and rationale along with a recommendation to varied audiences
‚Ä¢ Lean on industry standards and trusted methodologies but still experiment

We know there's no single path to becoming a content strategist. So, we look for:
‚Ä¢ A portfolio or link with the representation of your work, attached to your application
‚Ä¢ More than 5 years of professional experience with content strategy for large enterprise websites or applications, both internal and consumer-facing interfaces
‚Ä¢ Understanding of the development, sourcing, and governance of both structured and unstructured content types
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of mobile-first and responsive content strategies
‚Ä¢ Experience writing and revising content for the user interface
‚Ä¢ Experience working in Content Management Systems
‚Ä¢ Experience with localization and writing for a global audience
‚Ä¢ Experience with the UX lexicon and working in the UX design process
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in relevant field ‚Äî English, Communications, Linguistics, HCI, Design
‚Ä¢ Customer service and SEO experience are a plus.

#LI-KW1

At Expedia Group, we believe in bringing people together and creating an inclusive workplace where everyone belongs and can do their best work. We care about our employees' safety and wellbeing, so we're requiring new hires in the U.S. to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and present acceptable proof of vaccination before their start date as a condition of employment. Expedia Group will consider requests for a reasonable accommodation as required under applicable law.

About Expedia Group

Expedia Group (NASDAQ: EXPE) powers travel for everyone, everywhere through our global platform. Driven by the core belief that travel is a force for good, we help people experience the world in new ways and build lasting connections. We provide industry-leading technology solutions to fuel partner growth and success, while facilitating memorable experiences for travelers. Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. In this role you‚Äôll partner with consultants and teams to provide strategic guidance to a team of writers and creators. Your superpower is messaging. You have great interpersonal and collaboration skills and possess exceptional organizational skills, strong project management, and the capability to manage and contribute to multiple projects simultaneously. Storytelling is key to this role and you should be able to write a good one. You take a strategic approach; you start with the outcome in mind. You‚Äôre driven by solutions, not just driven by work. Keeping documentation current regarding process and digital style rules. ‚Ä¢ Ability to work closely with content teams, in coordinating copy, creative team (UX and Visual) on with acquiring digital assets, and technical development team on a content queries/needs. ‚Ä¢ Vetting copy before and after publishing to ensure it fits with establish brand and style guidelines. ‚Ä¢ Keeping track of change requests/client feedback, identifying content affected by each change, and ensuring consistent implementation. ‚Ä¢ Communicating, consulting & influencing on various website content items with client ‚Ä¢ Basic understanding of Agile/Scrum and have experienced working on project management tool (like Jira) Additional Information What you‚Äôll bring: 8-10 years of experience in a writing, creative strategy, content strategy, or editorial role Strong background creating clear, long and short form content and compelling CTAs: Please provide links to writing samples/portfolio (PDF, URLs) with your application Experience working closely with Marketing Leads in an iterative fashion Experience working with Director and VP level leadership Impeccable grammar and technical writing skills Ability to learn and embody a range of tones and voices in written form, given the diversity of project types and teams we work with Understanding of the business messaging ecosystem; ability to set up various messaging campaigns Strong project management skills Exceptional ability to distill and translate the big ideas into compelling narratives As part of our dedication to an inclusive and diverse workforce, Publicis Sapient is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. title: Freelance - Digital Content Publisher
description:

title: VP Content

title: Strategist
description:
What We Need

Codeword is looking for a creative strategist to join our growing team of digital, content and social media strategists and storytellers. From long-term planning to daily engagement, you‚Äôll be working on the content and internal comms strategy for one of the world‚Äôs largest tech brands. The ideal candidate is a self-starter with proven skills in managing digital content programs... (from strategy, to post creation and publishing, to measurement and optimization) and digital audience development (channel planning, testing, user growth).

You should be comfortable with in-depth research, building persuasive arguments, creative thinking, and rolling up your sleeves to execute.

What you'll be doing
‚Ä¢ Translating a brand‚Äôs story and business objectives into strategic and innovative digital content programs across paid, owned and earned media
‚Ä¢ Becoming a brand champion for our client, ensuring content is appropriate for tone, style and voice
‚Ä¢ Being the eyes and ears of our audience, the go-to expert on who they are and what they‚Äôre talking about, distilling insights into actionable tactics
‚Ä¢ Partnering with the editorial and creative teams to brief and brainstorm content that aligns with audience insights and supports client goals
‚Ä¢ Providing guidance and ensuring adherence to best practices across multiple digital platforms
‚Ä¢ Providing proactive creative inspiration and curation of relevant industry news, case studies and best practices to team members and clients
‚Ä¢ Helping set editorial strategy so content is consistent and compelling across all delivery streams

What you've been able to accomplish
‚Ä¢ 3-5 years of relevant experience developing content, comms, social media and/or audience development strategies in an agency or media publisher setting
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated ability to distill marketing goals and audience insights into executable strategy
‚Ä¢ Expertise in new media and social platforms, best practices, and how audiences use them to consume and share content
‚Ä¢ A firm understanding of multiple digital marketing disciplines and experience in building integrated strategies (i.e. Social Media, SEO, Paid Media, Email, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Ability to create and present killer, client-ready decks
‚Ä¢ Excellent written and verbal communication skills
‚Ä¢ Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
‚Ä¢ An entrepreneurial spirit, both working well with a team and individually
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with digital advertising industry and concepts
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with analytics and reporting (i.e. Google analytics, social CMS reporting, etc.)

About Us

Codeword:Codeword is a fast-growing agency that combines content, media relations and thoughtful creativity to build effective communications programs. We work with the biggest and smallest tech companies in the world, and our clients trust us to launch their startups, run multi-channel campaigns, grow their user bases, and lead comprehensive PR and marketing initiatives. We're storytellers and brand engineers, and we love big ideas that serve a real purpose.

Codeword is a proud member of the WE Worldwide network. We‚Äôre committed to an inclusive, diverse, equitable culture that values every team member and helps advance their careers. Codeword is a remote-first company, with physical office locations in San Francisco, New York, Austin, Salt Lake City, and Seattle/Bellevue.

title: Content Strategist and Messaging Consultant-Edge Solutions

Join us as a content strategist & messaging consultant on our Dell Technologies Edge Solutions team in the US (open to Austin, Texas, or remote US) to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact...

What you‚Äôll achieve

‚Ä¢ Create sales enablement & marketing content that tells our Edge portfolio story

You will:

Create Edge portfolio content such as eGuides, portfolio selection tools, customer presentations, and more to help sales & customers understand our success at the edge & value of our portfolio for edge applications

Desirable Requirements:

Here‚Äôs our story; now tell us yours

Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We‚Äôre proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What‚Äôs most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn‚Äôt stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what‚Äôs next in technology, starting today.

title: Digital Strategist
description:
Are you able to rapidly strategize a robust digital marketing plan for B2C and B2B clients?

Can you skillfully integrate earned, owned, and paid digital media into one comprehensive program?

Are you well-versed in channels like paid search, paid social, and SEO?

Can you analyze data and implement A/B testing to find hidden opportunities and possibilities?

Or help develop a multi-national digital media flighting plan for the next big product launch?

If the data-driven digital marketing practitioner we just described sounds like great fun, then we might have the perfect role for you.

Some things to know about us:

First, we're not like every other agency. We believe in the power of data. We embrace new tools and technology. We swoon over an elegant process or system. We love structured creativity. If it ain't broke, optimize it. As a result, we're growing faster than pretty much any other agency around.

Second, we work a little differently. In 48 marketing disciplines across 6... functional groups, we're redefining what a full-service marketing agency can be. Our digital marketing division is one of our fastest growing divisions and our digital strategists create insightful new business slide decks, thoughtful client presentations, and first-of-their kind analytics ‚Äî doing so with a global footprint in 20 countries.

Does any of this get you intrigued? Ready to break out a Google Analytics report? Are you wondering if this might just be the professional experience you've been searching for?

About TOP Worldwide
https://topagency.com/

TOP is a full-service global agency. We spread ideas and we help to grow brands. We‚Äôre proudly independent and composed of subject matter experts and award-winning thinkers, designers, content creators, digital storytellers and developers. We've become the world's fastest-growing PR, social, and digital agency because of our unique story-based and data-driven approach.

If you want the feel of a fast-growing startup with the variety of client work that comes from a top agency, then you've come to the right place

title: Content Strategist, Product
description:
We‚Äôre looking for Content Strategists to partner with Facebook designers, product managers, researchers and product marketers to plan and create the content for Facebook products, continually improve that content, and evolve Facebook's voice and content standards. You're perfect for this role if you are versatile, you‚Äôre able to plan and write content for web and mobile interfaces, including... interaction flows, product tours, transactional emails and launch education materials, as well as apply consistent standards and elevate the overall quality of our work; love both high-level strategy and hands-on writing and editing for web and mobile experiences; understand design thinking and user experience and thrive in a flat, fast-moving organization that uses light-weight process to have a huge impact.

Content Strategist, Product Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Plan, write, edit, test and improve content including interface language, product education materials, product names, navigational nomenclature and other content throughout Facebook experiences
‚Ä¢ Help apply and maintain consistency with content standards, and evolve Facebook‚Äôs voice
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with designers, researchers, product managers, product marketers and engineers to serve a global content audience
‚Ä¢ Share your work and give feedback to teammates
‚Ä¢ Promote content strategy at Facebook and in the broader community of design and content professionals

Minimum Qualifications
‚Ä¢ 5+ years working with content for web or mobile experiences
‚Ä¢ Please include a link to samples of your work that show an experience across different content types. You may show us content you‚Äôve created for user interfaces, microcopy, user education, direct or transactional emails, style guides or product launch content

Preferred Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Experience with social products
‚Ä¢ Information architecture or responsive content experience

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities ‚Äî we're just getting started.

Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-ext@fb.com

title: Executive Assistant, Amplify ELT
description:
Job Title: Executive Assistant, Amplify ELT

Job Location: Austin, Tx...

Company Background

Amplify Snack Brands, a division of Hershey, is a high growth ‚Äúbetter-for-you‚Äù snack brand company based in Austin, Texas. Led by a team of world-class executives, the company produces guilt-free snacking products and prides itself on having products that taste great with simple ingredients. Our brands, SkinnyPop, Paqui, Oatmega, Pirate‚Äôs Booty, and Krave embody our mission of ‚Äúsnacking without compromise.‚Äù For additional information, please visit: https://careers.amplifysnacks.com/

Position Summary

This Executive Assistant will provide primary support to the Amplify Executive Leadership Team (ELT) ‚Äì CFO, CCO, and VP, Supply Chain. The ideal candidate will have a high level of initiative, tact and professionalism. Under limited supervision, this position provides diverse administrative support, by performing a variety of routine and non-routine duties.

Responsibilities

The tasks include, but not limited to:
‚Ä¢ Drives department‚Äôs values of Communication, Collaboration and Commitment and the company‚Äôs global behaviors
‚Ä¢ Assisting in the preparation and design of presentations and major written reports by compiling data from numerous sources and composing drafts.
‚Ä¢ Producing reports, memos and correspondence and drafting responses to routine inquiries.
‚Ä¢ Answering telephone calls and taking messages, screening and redirecting calls.
‚Ä¢ Reviewing and responding to incoming email, mail, and calendar invites.
‚Ä¢ Identifying and tracking incoming email requests for to-do‚Äôs and delivery deadlines.
‚Ä¢ Scheduling appointments/meetings, coordinating travel arrangements (domestic and international) and briefing the ELT on details before the meetings and travel.
‚Ä¢ Administering departmental paperwork including invoices, purchases and reconciliation of government relations budget.
‚Ä¢ Proactive problem solver of organizational and business issues as appropriate.
‚Ä¢ Assisting with management of work environment to meet business and team member needs.
‚Ä¢ Manage ELT calendars by prioritizing schedules and meetings.
‚Ä¢ Assist in planning and organizing meetings by taking responsibility for assembling the agenda, location, meeting technology based on participant needs, and all other meeting logistics. May further prepare meeting briefing documents by taking and disseminating notes and formulating post-meeting action item lists.
‚Ä¢ Manage logistics including off-site meetings, booking rooms in 3rd party locations, and incorporating travel time and juggling logistics as appropriate.
‚Ä¢ Act as a proxy for communications and approvals as authorized. This includes interfacing with internal and external senior executives. You must be able to answer general questions as necessary and refer routine matters to appropriate parties and follow-up to ensure proper disposition.
‚Ä¢ Support department in coordination and scheduling of travel arrangements and process expense reports for President.
‚Ä¢ Support department with administrative tasks and analytical support as needed
‚Ä¢ May assist department with creation of Power Point decks for internal meetings with senior leaders.
‚Ä¢ Support the HR lead with various tasks including new hire onboarding/orientation, offboarding coordination, reporting, etc.
‚Ä¢ High level of integrity and ability to maintain confidentiality of sensitive company confidential information.

Qualifications
‚Ä¢ High school diploma required.
‚Ä¢ Associates or bachelor‚Äôs degree is strongly preferred.
‚Ä¢ CPS or AA designations are preferred.
‚Ä¢ Minimum 10 years progressive administrative experience and experience supporting Senior Executives strongly preferred.
‚Ä¢ Technology and social media fluency preferred.
‚Ä¢ Team Player, high energy
‚Ä¢ Excellent word processing/computer skills (PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Outlook, SAP, SharePoint, etc.).
‚Ä¢ Ability to manage and set multiple priorities.
‚Ä¢ Ability to interact with internal and external executives and customers
‚Ä¢ Pro-active thinking and action.
‚Ä¢ Analytical ability and personal initiative.
‚Ä¢ Strong attention to detail and communication skills (oral and written).
‚Ä¢ Follow-through and responsiveness.
‚Ä¢ Excellent organizational/time management skills.
‚Ä¢ Ability to handle confidential information.
‚Ä¢ Ability to use good judgement and discretion.

title: Executive Assistant - Austin, TX
description:
Executive Assistant - Austin, TX

Delivering solutions for customers around the globe takes huge vision ‚Äì but it‚Äôs our eye for detail that drives us forward. Professionals in our Administrative Support team take care of the vital details that keep our business running smoothly, worldwide. Take the first step towards your dream career

‚Ä¢ Proactive problem solver with exceptional communication and interpersonal skills

Desirable Requirements

Here‚Äôs our story; now tell us yours

Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. title: Senior Administrative Assistant
description:
WHAT YOU'LL DO

In this role, you'll ensure that the consultants we support have what they need to seamlessly serve the needs of our clients. This position involves booking (and unbooking) travel, scheduling (and rescheduling) meetings, keeping track of time and expenses, supporting the case team process, and generally keeping up with the fast pace of our Consulting Team...

While the consultants spend most of their time at the client site, back here at home base (aka the Austin, TX office) you will be surrounded by an Administrative Team that consists of a group of really smart, team-oriented people. Sr AAs actively participate in office life, are flexible and willing to help fellow Business Services Team (BST) members, and collaborate across functions. We work hard together, and we go out of our way to support each other ‚Äì we want everyone to be successful, individually and as a team.

We won't define a career path for you ‚Äì some of the Sr AAs we've hired in this role have gone on to have long and successful careers as Executive Assistants at BCG; others have gone into work in one of our many Practice Areas; some have managed teams or rotated through a number of other functions. Your career at BCG will be at the intersection of your skills and desires and the needs of our business; it will only be limited by your investment.

YOU'RE GOOD AT
‚Ä¢ Providing administrative support for Managing Directors or Partners in a fast-paced, high volume, and changing client service environment
‚Ä¢ Managing complex calendars with an understanding of business priorities
‚Ä¢ Organizing and scheduling client and internal meetings and events
‚Ä¢ Coordinating point-to-point travel needs as necessary including booking all travel and hotels, directions, commuting time, flight check in, and ground transportation
‚Ä¢ Processing timesheets and expenses on a timely basis
‚Ä¢ Supporting administrative aspects of Managing Directors and Partners internal commitments: practice area activities, BCG leadership committees, recruiting, etc.
‚Ä¢ Building effective working relationships with key stakeholders:
‚Ä¢ Managing Directors and Partners ‚Äì understand preferences relating to travel, calendar, etc.
‚Ä¢ Clients and their Assistants ‚Äì facilitate the scheduling process and relevant communications with friendly professionalism and high attention to detail
‚Ä¢ EA and AA peers ‚Äì work together to support other Managing Directors, Partners, and BST leaders on the case team; provide back-up assistance as needed
‚Ä¢ BST peers and internal resources ‚Äì obtain and share information with wider team as needed; help case team navigate internal resources
‚Ä¢ Performing other duties as assigned or required; responsibilities will vary

YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree, strongly preferred
Demonstrated leadership and/or customer service experience
‚Ä¢ 2 to 3 years‚Äô related experience, with experience supporting individuals at the executive level strongly preferred
‚Ä¢ Must be proficient in Windows 10 and Microsoft Office 2013

There are a few key things we look for ‚Äì do you have what it takes to step into these shoes?
‚Ä¢ High customer service orientation ‚Äì highly responsive, strong interpersonal and communication skills, wants to deliver great results at all times
‚Ä¢ Committed to improving the status quo ‚Äì we respect and hire people who are willing to ask questions, people who will say what's on their minds and are willing to make a suggestion, even if it is turned down
‚Ä¢ Sweats the small stuff ‚Äì strong attention to detail, accuracy, and follow-through, particularly when under pressure
‚Ä¢ Organized ‚Äì excellent at time and project management, has clear systems and composure to deal with multiple competing priorities at once while keeping constant sight of the overall objectives
‚Ä¢ Relationship-oriented ‚Äì extremely people focused with a certain 'joie de vivre' and the ability to develop effective working relationships with the Consulting Team, clients, and the wider Business Services Team (BST); Demonstrates respect for all individuals at all times
‚Ä¢ Good judgment ‚Äì highly professional and diplomatic (dealing with consultants who can be very demanding at times can be a challenge, but a challenge you're up for), knows when to ask for help or advice, is perceptive and practical
‚Ä¢ Trustworthy -- discreet (you will be privy to confidential information)
‚Ä¢ Flexible ‚Äì must be able to perform successfully in a fast-paced environment; doesn't get frustrated by priorities changing; open to feedback, adjusts to different working styles
‚Ä¢ Team player ‚Äì proactively seeks opportunities to help others, will go above and beyond in order to get the job done
‚Ä¢ Strong intellectual curiosity ‚Äì a creative thinker, interested in the big picture
‚Ä¢ Self-motivated ‚Äì a "can-do" attitude with an entrepreneurial spirit and a desire to take on an increasing level of responsibility

YOU'LL WORK WITH

Our business management and operations team members work to ensure that BCG is running smoothly, efficiently, and productively. We are made up of executive and administrative (or case team) assistants, visual service artists, receptionists, facilities staff, and the team leaders and office coordinators who manage these operations and business management jobs

title: Administrative Assistant
description: We are looking for a responsible Administrative Assistant to perform a variety of administrative and clerical tasks.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
ABOUT THE ROLEThe Administrative Assistant handles routine and advanced duties for other professionals.

They organize files, create correspondence, prepare reports and documents, manage calendars to schedule appointments, sort mail, prepare invoices and offer general staff support...
They may serve as an initial point of contact, answering phones and greeting visitors. They might engage in event planning and meeting setup and implementation. Very often they will make travel arrangements and generate itineraries.

They have to deal with other people from a wide variety of levels, from clients to management and even corporate CEOs.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES Answer phones and greet visitors Schedule appointments and maintain calendars Schedule and coordinate staff and other meetings Collate and distribute mail Prepare communications, such as memos, emails, invoices, reports and other correspondence Write and edit documents from letters to reports and instructional documents Create and maintain filing systems, both electronic and physical Manage accounts and perform bookkeepingMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Previous experience in office administration or other related fields Ability to prioritize and multitask Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong attention to detail Strong organizational skills

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Our health system is broken, and it‚Äôs a huge problem. Costs are rising out of control while the patient experience gets worse. At Sana, we're passionate about fixing this problem by bringing accessible and affordable health plans to small and medium businesses. We've built an innovative team with top talent from across the health insurance and tech industries to create engaging, modern plans for... our clients. This allows our customers to offer competitive benefits packages while paying an average of 20% less than traditional plans.

Sana is seeking a motivated, highly organized, trustworthy, and experienced executive assistant to work and grow alongside Sana‚Äôs CEO and our high performance executive team. Our company has grown from 30 people to 80 people in the last year; fast growth brings with it a lot of competing priorities. Your job is to free up more of the CEO‚Äôs time and provide the executive team leverage so we can be more impactful as an organization.

In this role, your time will be split:

40% supporting CEO with business admin tasks

40% directly supporting the executive team and business at large

20% helping manage tasks in the CEO‚Äôs personal life

What you will do

Keep the CEO focused on the most important initiatives for the business - setting weekly priorities together, proactively managing calendar and communications to make sure the most important tasks get accomplished

Triage CEO‚Äôs correspondence, primarily over email and slack, building an understanding of what messages should be prioritized (news, investor outreach, services, etc) so you can be an effective filter and eventually handle a substantial amount of the correspondence yourself

Proactively manage the CEO‚Äôs time - booking meetings and appointments, planning travel, and taking other administrative tasks off his plate

Own executive team functions such as coordinating our weekly All Hands meetings, setting agendas and note-taking with our weekly department head meetings, collecting and disseminating status updates on company goals (OKRs), etc.

Manage occasional HR and office tasks like collecting laptops from departing employees, coordinating logistics around team gatherings and finding vendors to provide one-off services for our office

Assist with miscellaneous personal tasks, including finding residential contractors, coordinating with nannies/daycare, researching gifts, setting doctor & vet appointments, etc. The CEO has a newborn daughter, a dog, and a house - responsibilities he shares with his wife who is also a busy startup executive. Taking some of these tasks off of his plate can be a big time saver.

About you

3+ years of experience as an EA or in a similar administrative function

Austin resident preferred, but full remote is possible for the right candidateExcellent communication skills - verbal and written

Extremely organized and 100% reliableExcited about entrepreneurship and business in general. It‚Äôs ok if you don‚Äôt want to be an EA forever.

Fast learner. You adapt to new situations, processes, domains of knowledge quickly.

High level computer proficiency, including familiarity with tools like Google Apps, Slack, and Zoom

Comfortable working from home - we have an office in South Austin, but half of our company is remote; the CEO works from home often and you will have the option to work remotely most of the time if you prefer

You can maintain confidentiality and use a high degree of discretion. You'll have visibility into a lot of business & personal life details.

Pass a background check (ie no criminal history)

About Sana

Sana is a modern health plan solution for small and medium businesses. We use a more efficient financing structure and integrated technology solutions to cut out wasteful spending and get members access to better quality care at lower cost. Founded in 2017, we are an experienced team of engineers, designers and health system operators. We have the financial backing of Silicon Valley venture firms and innovative reinsurance partners. If you are excited about building something new and being a part of fixing our broken healthcare system from the inside, please reach out

title: Executive Assistant (Remote)
description:
Executive Assistant to HR Leadership Team - Cognizant Corporate HR

Manager/ Senior Manager...

Provide secretarial and administrative support to a global HR leadership steam.

Duties to include:
‚Ä¢ Calendaring - Create, accept/decline, monitor and manage all aspects of exec calendar entries efficiently.
‚Ä¢ Outlook - Create, send, and respond to high-level internal and external email correspondence in impacting and effective fashion.
‚Ä¢ Meeting management - promptly prioritize and coordinate meeting requests in line with business objectives /demands both internal and external; proactively highlighting urgent issues/tasks.
‚Ä¢ Events management - arrange offsite meeting reservations or other stakeholder activities (internal and external), including negotiation of costs and management of logistics and venues.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Rex is an ecosystem that incubates, launches and operates tech startups across a number of sectors at the intersection of technology and real estate: Services, FinTech, InsureTech, Data Services, and more. We are creating the Future of Real Estate by building and launching multiple tech companies committed to serving and empowering people everywhere.

We are launching synergistic tech startups... that will scale via real estate into numerous industries creating a flywheel effect where each launch strengthens the value of the network, increases the talent density, accelerates cross-pollination of ideas, and creates mutually beneficial corporate and technical infrastructure.

Review our initiatives page for more details on the current companies and our culture page to understand who we are.

Job Role Overview

We are looking to add an Executive Assistant to support multiple members of the executive team. Our executive team provides support to our startup ecosystem where this role will focus on supporting our startup launches leaders.

The EA is hard-edged and does not take no for an answer. The ideal candidate has a strong bias for action and is not reactive or passive. The EA has a passion for administrative excellence; is driven, adventurous, humorous, and flexible. The EA must enjoy handling a wide range of duties, including clerical tasks, research, scheduling, and relationship management activities. The position requires the highest level of integrity as there is significant exposure to confidential and sensitive information.

What You‚Äôll Do
‚Ä¢ Balancing and coordinating complex executive calendars and meeting arrangements.
‚Ä¢ Prep for meetings/calls, take notes on key action-items, and distribute follow up items.
‚Ä¢ Flexibility and willingness to contribute to Special Projects as needed.
‚Ä¢ Coordinating with our facilities team on team events, company socials, and demo day events.
‚Ä¢ Expense tracking and monthly report preparation.
‚Ä¢ Executing on a wide variety of open-ended directives.
‚Ä¢ Anticipating needs and issues before they arise.
‚Ä¢ Managing outside vendors and coordinating with other teammates to leverage individual capacity.

What You Offer
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree
‚Ä¢ 2+ years of experience in a fast-paced administrative role
‚Ä¢ Strong attention to detail and organization
‚Ä¢ Experience with Google Suite (Gmail, Docs, Calendar), Slack and strong at asynchronous communication.
‚Ä¢ Proven track record of executing open-ended directives where discovery is needed up front.
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to handle confidential information with discretion, be adaptable to various competing demands, and demonstrate the highest level of client service and response.
‚Ä¢ Book smarts and street smarts
‚Ä¢ A strong desire to support the executive team and resilient enough to work at a early stage company

Before you apply, review these resources to better understand our culture and mission:
‚Ä¢ Rex ecosystem initiatives
‚Ä¢ Peter Rex writing in WSJ about moving Rex from Seattle to Austin
‚Ä¢ Peter Rex on Fox Business
‚Ä¢ Peter Rex on Bloomberg Radio

What We Offer
‚Ä¢ Competitive salary and early-in equity awards
‚Ä¢ Competitive and comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans
‚Ä¢ Peace of mind through company-paid short-term disability, long-term disability and life insurance
‚Ä¢ 401(K) with employer match
‚Ä¢ Unlimited (discretionary) PTO in addition to Holidays and your birthday off
‚Ä¢ Monthly gym membership stipend
‚Ä¢ Health Savings Account with employer contribution
‚Ä¢ Dependent Flexible Spending Account
‚Ä¢ Mental health telecounseling options
‚Ä¢ We are committed to serving others with a focus on faith, family, and freedom
‚Ä¢ Ability to work in person on hybrid schedule in Austin, Texas (or willing to relocate)

From the top-down, we are committed to investing in the development of all team members in both a professional and personal setting. We host monthly company socials where employees and family members get together to build our community. Regular performance evaluations are intended to provide a feedback loop, providing opportunities for consistent growth on both ends

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Job Description

Chisholm Trail Financial Group is a unique financial planning firm made up of 8 independent advisors. This position is to support 2 of the advisors in a part time capacity with plans to move to a full time capacity in next 2-4 years. This position would mainly be in Round Rock and Georgetown, TX. This is an in-person position with work from home potential once fully established... in the position.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Provide administrative support to 2 Financial Planners
‚Ä¢ Assist with calendar maintenance ‚Äì put appts on calendar and make changes as needed
‚Ä¢ Scan and FAX documents as needed
‚Ä¢ Assist in coordinating seminars and client events
‚Ä¢ Client meeting prep ‚Äì prepare appointment sheets and agendas, print last visit case notes, print personal profiles
‚Ä¢ Update accounts on client‚Äôs personal profile and accounts
‚Ä¢ Prepare and maintain client files including client paperwork, account statements, etc. in paper form and digital form
‚Ä¢ Enter and maintain client information in database
‚Ä¢ Confirm appointments
‚Ä¢ Assist with mailings
‚Ä¢ Must be proficient with Word, Excel and quickly learn and use new software as almost all communication and processing is digital.

Personal characteristics
‚Ä¢ Understand ethical behavior and business practices and ensure behavior is consistent with these standards and align with the values of the organization.
‚Ä¢ Establish and maintain positive working relationships with others both internally and externally to achieve the goals of the organization.
‚Ä¢ Speak, listen and write in a clear, thorough and timely manner using appropriate and effective communication tools and techniques.
‚Ä¢ Anticipate, understand, and respond to the needs of internal and external clients to meet or exceed their expectations within the organizational parameters.
‚Ä¢ Work cooperatively and effectively with others to set goals, resolve problems, and make decisions that enhance organizational effectiveness.
‚Ä¢ Maintain strict confidentiality with highly sensitive information.
‚Ä¢ Perform repetitive tasks while maintaining speed of work and attention to detail without loss to productivity.
‚Ä¢ Possess strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize workload and multi-task while maintaining attention to detail.

Position Type and Expected Hours of Work
This is a part time position requiring 15-20 hours a week.

Supervisory Responsibility
This position has no supervisory responsibilities, but there is opportunity for advancement.

Work Environment
This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, scanners, filing cabinets and fax machines.

Physical Demands
Filing is required. This would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets and bend or stand as necessary.

Required Education and Experience
High school diploma and one year of administrative experience is required.

Preferred Education and Experience
Associate degree and two years of related experience is preferred.

Work Authorization/Security Clearance
Full background check is conducted, including credit report and fingerprinting. Must be eligible for Securities Exchange Commission clearance.

EEO Statement
Chisholm Trail Financial Group (CTFG) is an Equal Opportunity employer and, as such, is committed in policy and practice to recruit, hire, compensate, train, and promote, in all job classifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, veteran status, or genetic information. Opportunities throughout CTFG are available to employees and applicants and are evaluated on the basis of job qualifications. We have a drug free work environment and we perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

Other Duties
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Company Description
Chisholm Trail Financial Group is a financial services firm committed to helping people pursue their financial goals. Our professionals offer a wide range of financial products and services to individuals and business owners. By providing educational financial information, we believe you will be better able to identify your goals and make informed decisions to help reach them

title: Executive Assistant To Chief Executive Officer
via: via Search And Find Your New Job Today With Bjobz
description: due to the high profile of this organization and this CEO, the company name has been removed. EMPLOYEE NEEDS TO LIVE IN AUSTIN, TX. EMPLOYEE AND COMPANY LOCATION Our team (25-30 employees) is fully remote. This is a remote opportunity (e.g., work from your home) but we are only considering candidates who reside in the Austin area, as our CEO and all family office personnel reside in the area. From time to time, we anticipate and encourage face-to-face connectivity between the CEO, his personal assistant, and this new EA role. OVERVIEW We are looking to add a kick-ass seasoned rockstar to our team who is experienced in calendar management, amongst other key skills. This role serves as THE gatekeeper of patient scheduling, internal meetings, and external consulting calls. You will play a strategic role in the direct oversight of developing, managing, and scheduling calendar priorities of an active and busy CEO. In partnership with our fully remote team, you will also be a liaison and... translator of the CEO's current calendar commitments and future availability. You will report to the company's COO - who is positioned to support any day-to-day questions and approve calendar adjustments. Acting as a conduit between our CEO and external partnerships, you are responsible for managing and monitoring an exceptional administrative experience (e.g., timely response, intuitive messaging, high aptitude in strategic planning, strong written correspondence, and quick follow-through of calendar invitation). As an extension of our CEO and the brand of our company, we expect strategic planning to reduce friction, inconvenience, redundancy in details, etc. This means thinking through calendar details (e.g., Zoom versus conference calls, multiple time zones, appointment privacy settings, travel time) WHAT THE JOB LOOKS LIKE 40%: Calendar management - i.e., perfect calendar invites (no errors) 25%: Rescheduling everything you just scheduled ;) 15%: Liason of internal relationships with colleagues and team members 10%: Developing external relationships with other executive assistants, chief of staffs, personal assistants 10%: Advancing technology and innovation around the role to ensure you're constantly bringing best practices into the job WHAT YOU BRING At least 5 years of experience supporting active calendars for an executive; Experience working in, and delivering, an exceptional administrative experience remotely via Outlook and Zoom; Experience working in a fast, high-touch, customer service orientated environment;; A demonstrated ability to strategically move and reshuffle an active calendar (quickly) while leveraging both phone and email correspondence; Exceptional analytical capacity and critical thinking/planning skills in order to identify, manage, delegate, and deliver efficiently across a small team A FEW OF OUR BENEFITS 401k safe harbor match 100% employer-sponsored medical, vision, and dental insurance (as well as, basic life, short term, and disability insurance) HSA and FSA spending account availability Generous PTO policy WFH benefit reimbursements - mobile and home internet Health and wellness reimbursements for relevant mobile apps or memberships
