description:
Description Introduction

Do you have the career opportunities as a Cardiovascular Operating Room Registered Nurse you want in your current role? We invest in what matters most to nurses like you ? at home, at work, and at every stage in your career. We have an exciting opportunity for you to join St. David's South Austin Medical Center which is a part of the nation's leading provider of... healthcare services, HCA Healthcare. Benefits

We are committed to providing benefits that matter to nurses. At St. David's South Austin Medical Center, our benefits package offers eligible colleagues an attractive benefit package that includes medical, wellbeing, dental and vision benefits along with some unique benefits including:
‚Ä¢ Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and Flexible Spending
‚Ä¢ Paid Time Off (PTO) and Personal Leave
‚Ä¢ 401K (100% annual match - 3% to 9% of pay based on years of service)
‚Ä¢ Academic Assistance and Reimbursements for Tuition and Student Loans
‚Ä¢ Employee Discounts including Tickets, Retail, Mental Health Apps, Education Apps, Identity Theft Protection etc.
‚Ä¢ Home, Auto, and Pet Insurance
‚Ä¢ Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP)
‚Ä¢ Short Term & Long Term Disability coverage
‚Ä¢ Adoption Assistance
‚Ä¢ Legal Benefits and lots more!

Learn more about Employee Benefits

Do you want to work where you have a voice? Nurses are at the forefront of our commitment to the care and improvement of human life. At HCA Healthcare, there are many ways for nurses to have a voice through professional practice councils, advisory councils, vital voices surveys, and units of distinction. We learn from our multi-generational nursing family. We partner with our Nurses at St. David's South Austin Medical Center! Job Summary and Qualifications

Our Registered Nurses raise the bar by providing clinical expertise and the highest quality care in the most compassionate way. Perioperative RNs assess, plan and implement the nursing care plan for the patient throughout the preoperative, intraoperative, and postoperative periods. These activities include patient assessment, monitoring the surgical field, patient education, monitoring the patient's condition, and integrating and coordinating patient care throughout the surgical care continuum. We are an amazing team, that works hard to support each other and are seeking a phenomenal addition like you, who feels patient care is as meaningful as we do.
‚Ä¢ You will plan, implement and evaluate patient care plans before, during and after the procedure to optimize outcomes and maximize available resources.
‚Ä¢ You will create and maintain a sterile and safe surgical environment.
‚Ä¢ You will monitor patient vital signs, sedation levels and physical/emotional well-being.
‚Ä¢ You will provide direct nursing care and supervise non-licensed nursing staff within the RN's scope of practice and in accordance with established policies.
‚Ä¢ You will provide pre- and post-operative patient education and emotional support appropriate to age, culture, condition, and circumstance.

During surgery, the perioperative nurse may assume any of the following responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Scrub nurse ? assists the surgeon within the sterile field by passing instruments, sponges, and other items needed during the surgical procedure.
‚Ä¢ Circulating nurse ? works outside the sterile field observing the surgical team from a broad perspective and assists anywhere needed.
‚Ä¢ RN First Assistant ? directly assist the surgeon by controlling bleeding and by providing wound exposure and suturing during the actual procedure (role requires additional education and training to deliver direct surgical care).

Education and Experience:
‚Ä¢ Associate's Degree in Nursing required
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's Degree in Nursing preferred
‚Ä¢ At least 2 years of nursing experience in the Operating room with Cardiac and Vascular procedures

Licenses and Certifications:
‚Ä¢ Current Texas RN license or a Compact RN license from a NCLA Compact State required. If Compact, a Texas license must be obtained within 90 days of hire date.
‚Ä¢ Current BCLS certification required
‚Ä¢ Certification by SGNA preferred

St. David's South Austin Medical Center is an acute-care facility in central Texas with more than 300 patient beds. The hospital is known in the community for its nationally accredited oncology program ? the Sarah Cannon Blood Cancer Center, home to the area's only adult bone marrow transplant program ? and Level II trauma center. The facility's full range of specialized services includes cardiovascular care and rehabilitation, imaging services, women's services, joint replacement and orthopedics, surgical services including weight loss surgery, wound care, emergency care, cancer care, nutrition services, and a sleep disorder center. The hospital operates three full-service emergency centers.

St. David's South Austin Medical Center is part of St. David's HealthCare, which is one of the largest healthcare systems in Texas and the third-largest employer in the Austin area. St. David's HealthCare was formed through a unique partnership between HCA Healthcare and two local non-profits ? St. David's Foundation and Georgetown Health Foundation.

HCA Healthcare has been named one of the World's Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere Institute for over a decade. In recent years, HCA Healthcare spent an estimated $3.7 billion in cost for the delivery of charitable care, uninsured discounts, and other uncompensated expenses. "Bricks and mortar do not make a hospital. People do." - Dr. Thomas Frist, Sr.
HCA Healthcare Co-Founder

If this opportunity is your next step in your career path, we encourage you to apply for our Cardiovascular Operating Room Registered Nurse opening. We review all applications. Qualified candidates will be contacted by a member of our team. We are interviewing apply today!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status

Description
Do you have the career opportunities as a Patient Safety Attendant (PSA) you want in your current role? We have an exciting opportunity for you to join St. David???s North Austin Medical Center, a facility that is part of the nation's leading provider of healthcare services, HCA Healthcare
...
At St. David???s North Austin Medical Center we want to ensure your needs are met. We offer a variety of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans along with some unique benefits including:
‚Ä¢ Tuition Reimbursement/Assistance Programs
‚Ä¢ Paid Personal Leave

You contribute to our success. Every role has an impact on our patients??? lives and you have the opportunity to make a difference. We are looking for a dedicated Patient Safety Attendant like you to be a part of our team.

As a Patient Safety Attendant (PSA) you will deliver high quality, patient-centered care by performing a variety of patient care services related to basic needs and continuous observation of high risk patients. In collaboration with the patient care team, including Registered Nurses and Patient Care Technicians, you will ensure the patient environment is free of obstacles and minimize risk of falls and accidental or intentional self-harm. You will deliver patient care while providing emotional and physical comfort to the patient.
‚Ä¢ You will demonstrate exceptional customer service, compassion and empathy in all interactions with patients and family
‚Ä¢ You will maintain direct line of sight with the patient at all times
‚Ä¢ You will accompany patients away from their room to ensure safety during transportation, testing and procedures
‚Ä¢ You will establish a safe, risk-free environment for patients through utilization of fall prevention protocols, infection control measures, and self-harm prevention
‚Ä¢ You will perform room assessment regularly and after any visitations
‚Ä¢ You will report any changes in patients??? physical or emotional conditions
‚Ä¢ You will be responsible for intervening patient from harming self or others
‚Ä¢ You will be responsible for recording information in patient medical records
‚Ä¢ You will maintain close communicate with physicians, nurses and healthcare team members regarding changes in a patient???s condition
‚Ä¢ You may also assist with basic daily living activities such as feeding and personal hygiene

St. David???s North Austin Medical Center, which is part of St. David???s HealthCare, is a 425-bed multi-specialty, acute care facility dedicated to the highest level of women???s health services, including maternity and newborn care with Level I, II and III nurseries at the adjacent St. David???s Women???s Center of Texas. The facility also features a 24-hour emergency department, the Texas Institute for Robotic Surgery, the Bariatric Center, Heart and Vascular Center, neurology and neurosurgery, a kidney transplant program, inpatient and outpatient surgery and acute inpatient and outpatient rehabilitation, among many others. St. David???s North Austin Medical Center is also home to St. David???s Children???s Hospital. St. David???s Surgical Hospital, which opened in October 2016, is a campus of St. David???s North Austin Medical Center.

HCA Healthcare has been continually named a World's Most Ethical Company by Ethisphere since 2010. In 2018, HCA Healthcare spent an estimated $3.3 billion in cost for the delivery of charitable care, uninsured discounts, and other uncompensated expenses.

If you are looking for an opportunity that provides satisfaction and personal growth, we encourage you to apply for our Patient Safety Attendant opening. We promptly review all applications. Highly qualified candidates will be contacted for interviews. Unlock the possibilities and apply today!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
.

Experience
‚Ä¢ 1+ years of experience in healthcare setting ??? preferred

Certifications
‚Ä¢ Current Basic Life Support (BLS) certification required per St. David???s Healthcare policy

Company Description:

HCA Healthcare is a collaborative healthcare network, driven by physicians, nurses and colleagues helping each other champion the practice of medicine to give people a healthier tomorrow. With a comprehensive network of more than 270,000 people across approximately 1,800 care facilities, our scale enables us to deliver great outcomes for our patients, provide superior nursing care and be a preferred place for physicians to practice medicine. We never stop in our pursuit of insights and care advances based on the knowledge and data we gain from approximately 30 million patient encounters a year. Every day, we raise the bar to improve the way healthcare is delivered, not just in our facilities, but everywhere. We're committed to improving more lives in more ways, and above all else, we are committed to the care and improvement of human life

description:
At CLEAResult, we're leading the transition to a sustainable, equitable and carbon-neutral future for our communities and our planet. When we start work every day, we know we're changing the world. We are marketers and engineers, energy advisors and systemic innovators determined to build a safer, cleaner and more sustainable future. As the largest provider of emission-reducing energy solutions... across North America, we offer our clients and partners everything they need to make using less energy easy and accessible for everyone.

Additionally, you will enjoy:

‚Ä¢ Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance; we also offer a company-paid health care concierge service to help navigate our health plan to make the best decisions for you and yours

‚Ä¢ 401(k) with company match

‚Ä¢ Paid vacation, sick, personal and parental leave time

‚Ä¢ Paid Volunteer Time: giving back to our communities is important to us

‚Ä¢ Employee Recognition Program - convert your recognition points into gift cards

‚Ä¢ Employee Assistance Program - offers benefits to help you manage daily responsibilities

Job Description

We're looking for a Senior Communications Manager to join our Corporate Communications team and help us amplify our purpose-driven brand, resulting in greater impact across North America. The Corporate Communications team is responsible for ensuring all internal and external communications for CLEAResult are consistent and engaging.

This role will report to the Director of Corporate Communications, and is an individual contributor position responsible for managing relationships with our internal and external agencies, developing communication assets and participating in the development of strategy for corporate messaging, social media content, public relations, CSR/ESG and thought leadership. We are looking for this person to be a knowledgeable thought partner on the team, bringing passion, practicality, and creativity.

Commitment to DEI

CLEAResult is committed to cultivating a people-first culture built on trust, accountability, and transparency; a place where every employee - regardless of position, role, or identity is treated with respect and given an equal chance to thrive. We believe that diversity, equity and inclusion are essential to winning the fight against climate change. If you're passionate about making a difference in your community and for the planet, then CLEAResult is an excellent place to grow your career and make a real difference for our shared future.

You're excited about this opportunity because you will...
‚Ä¢ Build brand and issues awareness by collaborating with other marketing teams as well as community, business and industry partners to effectively leverage the company's mission.
‚Ä¢ Have the flexibility to work remote or from our office in Austin, TX.
‚Ä¢ Manage work with internal subject matter experts (SMEs) and assist in executing CLEAResult positions on various topics.
‚Ä¢ Proactively identify industry trends and new approaches to drive improvements of communications programs, approaches and tools based on insights, best practices and business objectives.
‚Ä¢ Measure the impact of communications activities - PR and social media campaigns, internal communications, etc. Use data to make decisions on future communications.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with internal communications to deliver engaging, integrated campaigns and act as a backup to help govern and update the intranet, train intranet content contributors.
‚Ä¢ Draft public relations content including conference abstracts, award submissions and media pitches as well as content for social media channels and websites.
‚Ä¢ Work with colleagues in Digital Strategy, event marketing, Internal Communication, Product Marketing and operations to maintain content on social channels in support of company goals.
‚Ä¢ Partner with key stakeholders across the company to solve communications challenges and recommend solutions.
‚Ä¢ Actively participate in the development and execution of the strategy and ensure successful implementation of internal and external communications plans designed to more strongly connect key stakeholders with the company.
‚Ä¢ Track and report analytics, develop media reports, press releases, and corporate materials.
‚Ä¢ Define and build communication-specific capabilities in the organization necessary to meet the business strategy.
‚Ä¢ Help develop cross-functional capability to view communications from the lens of the audience, while ensuring key messages come through clearly.
‚Ä¢ Manage communication plans and timelines to ensure successful delivery of communication campaigns.
‚Ä¢ Be a trusted advisor and provide strategic communication counsel to internal stakeholders, particularly at the senior level, regarding building our brand, thought leadership, employee engagement and communications issues and challenges.

We're excited about you because of your‚Ä¶
‚Ä¢ Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with superb ability to translate ideas into clear, compelling messaging.
‚Ä¢ Ability to demonstrate working knowledge of communications trends, best practices and emerging approaches, and prior experience using mediums and methods to engage internal and external audiences (social networking, video, digital etc.) is strongly desired.
‚Ä¢ 7-10+ years relevant communications experience, additional consideration if you have a Bachelor degree in a communications-related field.
‚Ä¢ Experience with crisis communications and PR.
‚Ä¢ Analytical mindset, sharp editing skills and keen eye for design.
‚Ä¢ Quick wit, entrepreneurial attitude and intellectual curiosity.
‚Ä¢ Effective project management skills, ability to manage numerous projects with tight deadlines and be an enthusiastic team player who can work cross-functionally with many partner teams.
‚Ä¢ Comfort with ambiguity and ability to respond quickly and gracefully to shifting priorities.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency with Microsoft Office 365, especially SharePoint, Word and PowerPoint, additional consideration if you have experience with Microsoft Teams

MAIN JOB TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Overview

Hiring immediately for sales associates and customer service representatives looking to become an Amazing Lash Studio  Lash Consultant. Start your long and rewarding career with the Amazing Lash Studio  brand today...

Responsibilities

Hiring for a retail sales associate / customer service representative in the beauty industry.  The Amazing Lash Studio  brand is the industry leader for eyelash extension and eyebrow services with a mission to create lasting beauty and confidence through passion, dedication and excellence so our guests will look and feel AMAZING!

 
‚Ä¢ *COVID-19 Update**

Following a temporary closure due to COVID-19, The health and safety of clients and our team members is our top priority. We have implemented new safety protocols and elevated cleaning procedures in accordance with federal and state guidelines for your protection. These include, but are not limited to: 
‚Ä¢ client screening questions, 
‚Ä¢ temperature checking, 
‚Ä¢ the use of personal protective equipment (PPE), and 
‚Ä¢ strategic scheduling to allow for cleaning between appointments.

 

Retail Sales Associate / Customer Service Representative Benefits:
‚Ä¢ Competitive compensation plan depending on performance
‚Ä¢ Paid Time Off, vacation and sick
‚Ä¢ Free eyelash services including volume upgrades
‚Ä¢ Membership sales bonus
‚Ä¢ Flexible Hours
‚Ä¢ Discounts on all retail products
‚Ä¢ A fun culture where bagel Friday is real
‚Ä¢ Clear career path to grow as a professional
‚Ä¢ Ongoing training

 

Retail Sales Associate / Customer Service Representative Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Promoting and selling Amazing Lash Studio  Membership and retail products to guests
‚Ä¢ Assists Studio Manager with retaining current members
‚Ä¢ Consistently creates a friendly environment for guests by welcoming and assisting as well as quickly responding to customer questions and needs
‚Ä¢ Answers phone calls, book appointments, and enthusiastically greeting guests
‚Ä¢ Assist in administrative tasks including filing and data entry of guests records and surveys
‚Ä¢ Prepare guest records for treatments
‚Ä¢ Participate in special events to promote the studio
‚Ä¢ Maintains cleaning, organizing, and maintenance of lobby and studio public areas
‚Ä¢ Maintains quality service by enforcing organization standards

 

Retail Sales Associate / Customer Service Representative Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Customer service oriented
‚Ä¢ Results oriented, metrics driven
‚Ä¢ Sales experience preferred
‚Ä¢ Basic computer skills
‚Ä¢ Ability to multitask
‚Ä¢ Must be outgoing, positive, cheerful, engaging, energetic, and resourceful
‚Ä¢ Strong verbal and written communications skills
‚Ä¢ Possess strong interpersonal skills to communicate with confidence to both internal personnel and customers
‚Ä¢ Must be an excellent organizer and problem solver with strong project management skills
‚Ä¢ Must be able to work flexible days and hours; including nights, weekends, and holidays
‚Ä¢ Millennium Salon Software experience a plus

 

Apply today to see if Amazing Lash Studio  brand is a great fit for you.  We would love to meet you and discuss the possibility of a long and rewarding career!

Each Amazing Lash Studio  location is independently owned and operated. Franchise owners (or their designated hiring managers) are solely responsible for all employment and personnel decisions and matters regarding their independently owned and operated studios, including hiring, direction, training, supervision, discipline, discharge, compensation (e.g., wage practices and tax withholding and reporting requirements), and termination of employment. Amazing Lash Franchise, LLC (ALF) is not involved in, and is not responsible for, employment and personnel matters and decisions made by any franchise owner. All individuals hired by franchise owners  studios are their employees, not those of ALF.  This is not an offer of employment by ALF.  Benefits vary by independently owned and operated Amazing Lash Studio  locations.  Amazing Lash Studio  and Amazing Lash Studio design are registered trademarks owned by ALF

title: none
description:
Are you looking to work with a dynamic team? We are hiring passionate and friendly individuals who are looking to make a difference and bring joy to the community! Join our Membership team by becoming a Welcome Center team member.

Apply Today...

How you will contribute to our Purpose:

The YMCA of Austin is a dynamic, equitable force in the community that helps people of all backgrounds improve their total wellbeing and quality of life. Founded in 1953 and anchored in three Central Texas counties, the Y is a $40 million community enterprise that serves nearly 100,000 people annually through eight centers. We also provide afterschool education and care at more than 70 licensed campuses in four school districts. Unlike any other organization in the region, the Austin Y has the unique ability to welcome, educate and elevate all, and is committed to creating innovative programs, places‚Ä¶and people.

As Welcome Center Team Member, you will play a critical role in serving our members, program participants and providing a quality experience for everyone who enters our doors. You will serve as the focal point for all member inquiries, program registration, and all questions related to programming and membership. You are required to act with intentionality to connect participants to our purpose through service. As an organization dedicated to living our purpose we show up to welcome, connect, support, and invite our participants to engage with each other and the YMCA.

Pay Rate: $15.00 per hour

Availability: Monday- Friday 5:15am-7:00pm. Saturday 8am-6pm, Sunday 12pm-6pm

Rewards we offer you:
‚Ä¢ Free Household Membership to facilities operated by the YMCA of Austin (worth $1,000 annually)
‚Ä¢ 12% Employer-Funded Retirement Plan upon meeting eligibility
‚Ä¢ Access to 403b savings upon hire
‚Ä¢ Learning and development workshops and trainings
‚Ä¢ Career advancement opportunities
‚Ä¢ Flexible schedules

What are the details?
‚Ä¢ You actively engage and greet members and guests that come into the YMCA.
‚Ä¢ You may be required to open or close the facility and have key-holding duties.
‚Ä¢ You provide excellent service to members, guests, and program participants in the Y and on the phone, contributing to member retention.
‚Ä¢ You provide tours to potential new members.
‚Ä¢ You keep informed of all branch activities & schedules to provide exceptional member service.
‚Ä¢ You handle and resolve membership concerns and inform the supervisor of unusual situations or unresolved issues.
‚Ä¢ You reconcile end-of-shift money received through the sale of membership, merchandise, mini-camp, and program registrations.
‚Ä¢ You complete other duties as assigned.

What you bring to the Purpose:
‚Ä¢ Education and Experience: You are a minimum of 16 years old and have some experience in customer service. Bilingual (English and Spanish) is preferred.
‚Ä¢ You are a team player. You are a team player with a positive, service-oriented attitude and you can work well with others.
‚Ä¢ You are organized and productive. You are organized, able to prioritize tasks and handle multiple assignments.
‚Ä¢ You are a strong communicator. You listen for knowledge and meaning. You speak and write effectively.
‚Ä¢ You foster a culture of inclusion and belonging. You leverage people‚Äôs differences as strengths.

The organization has reviewed this job description to ensure that essential functions and basic duties have been included. It is not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all functions, responsibilities, skills, and abilities. Additional functions and requirements may be assigned by supervisors as deemed appropriate.

The YMCA of Austin provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.YMCA of Austin complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which we have employees. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Please visit the City of Lakeway website to read the full job description, learn about our excellent benefit package and to apply. Any questions contact Wendy Askey, HR Director at 512-314-7508

Deputy Court Clerk I: starts at $16.91 ($35,180) with no TCCA certification...

Deputy Court Clerk II: starts at $17.75 ($36,939) and up with level I TCCA cert.

Deputy Court Clerk III: starts at $19.58 ($40,726) and up to $24.03 ($50,000) with level II, TCCA cert.

Full Time, Monday ‚Äì Friday, mainly 8 am-5 pm, with occasional night courts which normal last to 8 pm.

Link to read job description and benefit package, and to apply: CivicHR | Applicant Tracking System (civicplushrms.com)

Under the general supervision of the Court Administrator and his/her designee, work involves daily public contact requiring tact and diplomacy with excellent customer service in processing a wide variety of court cases of the Lakeway Municipal Court.

REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS:

Reports to: Court Administrator

Supervises: none

MAIN JOB TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES
‚Ä¢ Collects public funds at the Municipal Court service window by receiving cash, checks, money orders, and credit card payments in person, by mail, drop box, and online; issues receipts and credits payments on account for fines and other Court-related business for transactions requiring knowledge of payment and status codes, regulations, and departmental policy.
‚Ä¢ Attends walk-in customers and receives court documents from the general public, defendants, and attorneys. Provides public information and customer service assistance by explaining court procedures and the different options available to defendants in person, by telephone, mail, e-mail or fax. Refers customers to appropriate staff for assistance with sensitive and private matters.
‚Ä¢ Processes online payments and enters notes in the case management system to release paid violations.
‚Ä¢ Exercises, initiative, judgment, and discretion when handling confidential and sensitive information.
‚Ä¢ Verifies daily collections of court fines and fees.
‚Ä¢ Processes and reviews community service orders, verify completion of community service hours, submittal to the court, dates, and closes the case.
‚Ä¢ Prepares and mails appropriate court case letters and documentation to defendants.
‚Ä¢ Processes daily recording of case disposition, court orders, and arrangements in the case management system.
‚Ä¢ Answers inquiries or questions concerning court matters in person, by telephone, mail, e-mail, or fax.
‚Ä¢ Explains procedures, options and forms to parties in case.
‚Ä¢ Verifies insurance coverage and updates/closes file.
‚Ä¢ Provides other general office services as required.
‚Ä¢ Performs other duties that support the overall objective of the position as assigned by the Supervisor.
‚Ä¢ Conveys a positive professional image by action, communication, and
‚Ä¢ Regular, reliable, and punctual attendance is an essential function of this job.
‚Ä¢ Contributes to team effort by performing other duties as assigned by Supervisor.
‚Ä¢ Follows Judge‚Äôs Standing Orders and performs duties ethically following the Judicial Cannons.
‚Ä¢ Must adhere to City/Departmental Policies and Procedures and follow Security and Safety Regulations

title: none
description:
Amazon Delivery Station Warehouse Associate
Job Overview
You'll be part of the dedicated Amazon team at the delivery station - the last stop before we deliver smiles to customers. Our fast-paced, physical roles receive trucks full of orders, then prepare them for delivery. You'll load conveyor belts, and transport and stage deliveries to be picked up by drivers. You may even be part of the team... that works with larger items, such as large screen TVs, furniture, and appliances, and be trained on how to use technology to handle these heavy bulk items.

Duties & Responsibilities

Some of your duties may include:
‚Ä¢ Receive and prepare inventory for delivery
‚Ä¢ Use technology like smartphones and handheld devices to sort, scan, and prepare orders
‚Ä¢ View prompts on screens and follow direction for some tasks
‚Ä¢ Build, wrap, sort, and transport pallets and packages
‚Ä¢ Receive truck deliveries

You'll also need to be able to:
‚Ä¢ Lift up to 49 pounds
‚Ä¢ Stand, walk, push, pull, squat, bend, and reach during shifts
‚Ä¢ Use carts, dollies, hand trucks, and other gear to move items around
‚Ä¢ Go up and down stairs (where applicable)
‚Ä¢ Work at a height of up to 40 feet on a mezzanine (where applicable)
What it's like at an Amazon Delivery Station
‚Ä¢ Safety. Your safety is important to us, so we provide protective gear. All teams share safety tips daily.
‚Ä¢ Surroundings. You'll be working around moving machines - order pickers, stand-up forklifts, turret trucks, and mobile carts.
‚Ä¢ Activity. Some activities may require standing in one place for long periods, walking around, or climbing stairs.
‚Ä¢ Temperature. Even with climate controls, temperatures can vary between 60¬∞F and 90¬∞F in some parts of the warehouse; on hot days, temperatures can be over 90¬∞F in the truck yard or inside trailers.
‚Ä¢ Noise level. It can get noisy at times. We provide hearing protection if you need it.
‚Ä¢ Dress code. Relaxed, with a few rules to follow for safety. Comfortable, closed-toe shoes are required. Depending on the role or location, Amazon provides a $110 Zappos gift code towards the purchase of shoes, in order to have you prepared for your first day on the job.
Why You'll Love this Job
‚Ä¢ Stay busy. You and your team are engaged the entire shift.
‚Ä¢ Schedule options. Depending on where you work, schedules may include Full time (40 hours), reduced-time (30-36 hours) or part-time (20 hours or less), all with the option of working additional hours if needed.
‚Ä¢ Shift flexibility. Work when it works for you. Shifts may include overnight, early morning, day, evening, and weekend. You can even have four-day workweeks, three-day weekends - and with Anytime Shifts, you can work as little as four hours per week.
‚Ä¢ Anytime Pay. You can instantly cash out up to 70% of your earnings immediately after your shift (for select employee groups, within select businesses). Learn more about Anytime Pay .
‚Ä¢ Career advancement. We have made a pledge to upskill our employees and offer a variety of free training and development programs, and we also have tuition support options for select employee groups. See where your Amazon journey can take you.
‚Ä¢ New skills. Depending on the role and location, you'll learn how to use the latest Amazon technology - including handheld devices and robotics.
‚Ä¢ Team environment. Work on small or large teams that support each other.
Why You'll Love Amazon
Many of our jobs come with great benefits - including healthcare, parental leave, ways to save for the future, and opportunities for career advancement - all in a safe and inclusive environment that's been ranked among the best workplaces in the world. Some offerings are dependent upon the role, work schedule, or location, and can include the following:
‚Ä¢ Competitive wage paid weekly, with overtime for more than 40 hours
‚Ä¢ Healthcare (medical, dental, vision, prescription drugs)
‚Ä¢ Medical Advice Line
‚Ä¢ Network of Support (health & well-being on and off the job)
‚Ä¢ Adoption Assistance
‚Ä¢ Maternity and Parental Leave
‚Ä¢ 401(k) savings plan
‚Ä¢ Paid Time Off (PTO)
‚Ä¢ Holiday pay opportunities
‚Ä¢ Employee discounts
‚Ä¢ Basic life insurance
‚Ä¢ AD&D insurance
‚Ä¢ Company-paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
‚Ä¢ On-the-job training and skills development
‚Ä¢ Employee Assistance Program

Learn more about Amazon Benefits and Culture

https://hiring.amazon.com/why-amazon/benefits#/

https://hiring.amazon.com/why-amazon/culture#/

Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Candidates must be 18 years or older with the ability to understand and adhere to all job requirement and safety guidelines.

How To Get Started
You can begin by applying above. If you need help with your application or to learn more about our hiring process, you can find support here: https://hiring.amazon.com/hiring-process#/.

For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation during the application and hiring process, please visit https://hiring.amazon.com/people-with-disabilities#/or contact the Applicant-Candidate Accommodation Team (ACAT). You can reach us by phone at 888-435-9287, Monday through Friday, between 6 a.m. and 4 p.m. PT.

You may contact us if you need an accommodation during the application and hiring process or in your new role and would like to initiate a request prior to starting your Day 1. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://hiring.amazon.com/people-with-disabilities#/

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status

description:
Description:

$25 - $32/hour based on experience...

Join the dedicated Badger Team - the LEADER in the hydro-excavation industry. Full-time Operator positions available immediately, with career advancement opportunities, competitive pay, overtime, weekly pay, bonus incentives, PTO, and health care benefits.

In this position you will operate our custom and purpose built commercial Hydrovac trucks to drive to assigned job site to excavate, load, dig, break rocks or debris, dirt, or other materials to locate underground utilities, potholing, trenching, etc. The Hydrovac Operator is responsible for the completion of projects in a safe and timely manner.

Learn about A Day in the Life of Badger

Full availability and understanding to work variable hours averaging between 30-70 hours weekly depending on slow and peak seasons. Weekends and extended hours as needed.
Required travel up to 25% based on job assignment need.
Attend safety meetings and ensures all tasks are always completed in a safe and professional manner.
Safely operate the on-board hydro-vacuum system outside the truck and perform other duties such as clean-up, mobilization, and general maintenance of the equipment to ensure the unit operates at max capacity.
Must be able to work in all outdoor elements for extended periods of time throughout the year.
Responsible for the successful completion of hydro excavation projects including utility line exposure, debris removal, trenching, and digging, using a high-pressure wand to loosen the soil and a vacuum system to remove the debris or build-up.
Communicate effectively, professionally and demonstrate a strong customer service focus in all interactions.
Troubleshoot minor mechanical issues and as the need arises perform minor repairs to equipment.
Use Badger provided technology (iPad) for field ticketing, time, and attendance.
Properly document all Badger, Federal, State, and Customer paperwork as required by law and/or established policy in a clear and legible manner.
Must be able to meet the following physical demands\:
‚Ä¢ Must be able to hear and distinguish emergency signals and instructions while on duty.
‚Ä¢ Must be able to repetitively sit, lift, stoop, bend, squat, kneel, reach, and crawl.
‚Ä¢ Must be able to repeatedly lift a maximum of 50 pounds.
‚Ä¢ Must be able to work in all outdoor elements for extended periods of time throughout the year.
‚Ä¢ Confined Space Entry may be required to accomplish tasks for some clients when applicable.
‚Ä¢ Must be cleared to wear Personal Protective Equipment (PPE).
‚Ä¢ Must be able to climb ladders, and work from stationary platforms from elevated heights.
‚Ä¢ Must be capable of working extended hours and variable shifts.
‚Ä¢ Must be able to work in loud environments and may require use of ear plugs. Qualification:

Previous hydrovac, trucking, vacuum truck or other related industrial experience preferred.
Must have a minimum CDL A or B license, with an acceptable driving record. Tanker endorsement required.
OSHA10 safety certification is required. (If applicant does not hold this certification, Badger will pay for computer-based training with applicant completing on-line course within 5 days of hiring. Certification is the property of the applicant.)
Safety certifications preferred (e.g. First Aid/CPR, Fall Protection, Confined Space).
Experience in a labor-intensive position and working outside in all types of weather conditions.
Ability to work independently in a team and safety focused environment.
Mechanical inclination is an asset.

Candidates will be required to successfully complete pre-employment screening, which includes criminal background check, MVR history, drug and alcohol test, physical (DOT & Non- DOT), and a Functional Capacity Evaluation (FCE).

Thank you for your interest in this position. Badger Daylighting is an Equal Opportunity Employer

We expect respectful communication (despite pressure), openness to feedback, an eagerness to learn, and an overall positive attitude! Roles may require the following: Overtime may be required to meet deadlines Varying schedule due to, breaking news and/or daily news coverage requirements Provide 24x7, 365 days per year, on-call support. description:
Amazon Delivery Station Warehouse Associate

Job Overview...

You'll be part of the dedicated Amazon team at the delivery station - the last stop before we deliver smiles to customers. Our fast-paced, physical roles receive trucks full of orders, then prepare them for delivery. You'll load conveyor belts, and transport and stage deliveries to be picked up by drivers. You may even be part of the team that works with larger items, such as large screen TVs, furniture, and appliances, and be trained on how to use technology to handle these heavy bulk items.

Duties & Responsibilities

Some of your duties may include:
‚Ä¢ Receive and prepare inventory for delivery
‚Ä¢ Use technology like smartphones and handheld devices to sort, scan, and prepare orders
‚Ä¢ View prompts on screens and follow direction for some tasks
‚Ä¢ Build, wrap, sort, and transport pallets and packages
‚Ä¢ Receive truck deliveries

You'll also need to be able to:
‚Ä¢ Lift up to 49 pounds
‚Ä¢ Stand, walk, push, pull, squat, bend, and reach during shifts
‚Ä¢ Use carts, dollies, hand trucks, and other gear to move items around
‚Ä¢ Go up and down stairs (where applicable)
‚Ä¢ Work at a height of up to 40 feet on a mezzanine (where applicable)
What it's like at an Amazon Delivery Station
‚Ä¢ Safety. Your safety is important to us, so we provide protective gear. All teams share safety tips daily.
‚Ä¢ Surroundings. You'll be working around moving machines - order pickers, stand-up forklifts, turret trucks, and mobile carts.
‚Ä¢ Activity. Some activities may require standing in one place for long periods, walking around, or climbing stairs.
‚Ä¢ Temperature. Even with climate controls, temperatures can vary between 60¬∞F and 90¬∞F in some parts of the warehouse; on hot days, temperatures can be over 90¬∞F in the truck yard or inside trailers.
‚Ä¢ Noise level. It can get noisy at times. We provide hearing protection if you need it.
‚Ä¢ Dress code. Relaxed, with a few rules to follow for safety. Comfortable, closed-toe shoes are required. Depending on the role or location, Amazon provides a $110 Zappos gift code towards the purchase of shoes, in order to have you prepared for your first day on the job.
Why You'll Love this Job
‚Ä¢ Stay busy. You and your team are engaged the entire shift.
‚Ä¢ Schedule options. Depending on where you work, schedules may include full-time (40 hours), reduced-time (30-36 hours) or part-time (20 hours or less), all with the option of working additional hours if needed.
‚Ä¢ Shift flexibility. Work when it works for you. Shifts may include overnight, early morning, day, evening, and weekend. You can even have four-day workweeks, three-day weekends - and with Anytime Shifts , you can work as little as four hours per week.
‚Ä¢ Anytime Pay. You can instantly cash out up to 70% of your earnings immediately after your shift (for select employee groups, within select businesses). Learn more about Anytime Pay .
‚Ä¢ Career advancement. We have made a pledge to upskill our employees and offer a variety of free training and development programs, and we also have tuition support options for select employee groups. See where your Amazon journey can take you.
‚Ä¢ New skills. Depending on the role and location, you'll learn how to use the latest Amazon technology - including handheld devices and robotics.
‚Ä¢ Team environment. Work on small or large teams that support each other.
Why You'll Love Amazon
Many of our jobs come with great benefits - including healthcare, parental leave, ways to save for the future, and opportunities for career advancement - all in a safe and inclusive environment that's been ranked among the best workplaces in the world. Some offerings are dependent upon the role, work schedule, or location, and can include the following:
‚Ä¢ Competitive wage paid weekly, with overtime for more than 40 hours
‚Ä¢ Healthcare (medical, dental, vision, prescription drugs)
‚Ä¢ Medical Advice Line
‚Ä¢ Network of Support (health & well-being on and off the job)
‚Ä¢ Adoption Assistance
‚Ä¢ Maternity and Parental Leave
‚Ä¢ 401(k) savings plan
‚Ä¢ Paid Time Off (PTO)
‚Ä¢ Holiday pay opportunities
‚Ä¢ Employee discounts
‚Ä¢ Basic life insurance
‚Ä¢ AD&D insurance
‚Ä¢ Company-paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
‚Ä¢ On-the-job training and skills development
‚Ä¢ Employee Assistance Program

Learn more about Amazon Benefits and Culture

description:
Your time. Your Goals.

What is DoorDash...

Available in over 4,000 cities in the U.S, DoorDash connects local businesses and local drivers (called Dashers) with opportunities to earn, work, and live.

As a Dasher, you can be your own boss and enjoy the flexibility of choosing when, where, and how much you earn. All you need is a mode of transportation (bike, car, scooter) and a smartphone to start making money. It's that simple. You can even sign up and begin working that same day. With Dasher Direct, you can also get paid the same day!

Why deliver with DoorDash
‚Ä¢ Choose your own hours: When and where you work is totally up to you.
‚Ä¢ Freedom to dash anywhere: Deliver near your home or in a city you're just visiting.
‚Ä¢ Easy to get started: Don't worry about car inspections or vehicle restrictions. Just sign up and receive everything you need to start earning.
‚Ä¢ Receive deliveries right away: Once approved, log on to the Dasher app to receive nearby orders immediately.
‚Ä¢ Know how much you'll make: Clear and concise pay model lets you know the minimum amount you will make before accepting any order
‚Ä¢ Don't wait for pay: Get paid the same day you dash, automatically and with no deposit fee - ever.
‚Ä¢ Earn extra money for your goals: Achieve your short-term goals or long-term dreams by driving or biking with DoorDash.

Sign Up Details

Requirements
‚Ä¢ 18 or older
‚Ä¢ Any car, scooter, or bicycle (in select cities)
‚Ä¢ Driver's license number
‚Ä¢ Social security number (only in the US)
‚Ä¢ Final Step: consent to a background check

How to sign up
‚Ä¢ Click Apply Now and complete the sign up
‚Ä¢ Get the app and go

Actual earnings may differ and depend on factors like number of deliveries completed, time of day, location, and expenses. Hourly pay is calculated using average Dasher payouts while on a delivery (from the time you accept an order until the time you drop it off) over a 90 day period and includes compensation from peak pay, tips, and other incentives

description:
*General Job Description Purpose: *
The purpose of this job description is to communicate the responsibilities and duties associated with the position of Maintenance Technician. It should also be noted that responsibilities and duties might not be specifically addressed.
‚Ä¢ General Position Summary: ...
The Maintenance Technician is to assist the Maintenance Supervisor in maintaining the physical integrity of the community. This involves ensuring a safe, secure and comfortable living environment for residents, visitors, and staff. The Maintenance Technician will carry out assigned duties in a safe manner and other duties as requested by the Maintenance Supervisor. In the absence of the Maintenance Supervisor, the Maintenance Technician will assume all maintenance responsibilities.
‚Ä¢ Essential Duties: *
‚Ä¢ The Maintenance Technician will conduct all business in accordance with company policies and procedures and all state and federal regulations (such as Lead Based Paint, ADA, Fair Housing, HAZCOM Program, OSHA, etc.).
‚Ä¢ Must be knowledgeable of all pertinent laws and EPA and OSHA regulations.
‚Ä¢ Must be aware of the condition of the property at all times and take immediate steps to correct any unsafe condition.
‚Ä¢ Schedule and perform routine preventive maintenance on all appropriate equipment as directed by the Maintenance Supervisor and the Community Manager. Inspect and maintain all tools in excellent condition.
‚Ä¢ Must be aware of all utility meter cut-offs, apartment and fixture cut-offs, and sewer clean-outs.
‚Ä¢ Perform work area clean-up and safety related duties.
‚Ä¢ Ensure that storage areas remain locked when not in use.
Diagnose and perform minor or routine maintenance or repair, as directed, involving the following on a daily basis:
1. Electrical and plumbing
2. A/C and heating systems
3. Appliances
4. Water irrigation systems
5. Stairs, gates, fences, patios, railings
6. Tile, carpet, and flooring
7. Roofing, gutters, fasteners
8. Interior/exterior lights
9. Fireplaces, ceiling fans
10. Gas fixtures and appliances
11. Shutters, doors, cabinets, windows, sliding glass doors
12. Boiler, gas and electric
13. Door locks, P.O. boxes and locks
14. Security systems
15. Ceiling leaks
16. Walls
17. Pool areas, tile, hot tub/spa, pool furniture
‚Ä¢ Inspect and help coordinate all needed market-ready repairs and services. Assist market-ready staff as required to meet deadlines.
‚Ä¢ Report all major repairs and need requisitions to Maintenance Supervisor prior to any expenditure of funds.
‚Ä¢ Change locks and make keys.
‚Ä¢ Remove and transfer heavy appliances and equipment from storage area to apartment (or vice versa) as circumstances warrant. Assist in moving abandoned furniture, appliances, etc. to dumpster when necessary.
‚Ä¢ Respond to any other requests made by the Maintenance Supervisor, Community Manager, Regional Maintenance Director, Regional Manager, or other company official as needed.
‚Ä¢ Education, Knowledge, Skills*
‚Ä¢ Current Certifications in EPA, CPO, Mold Class
‚Ä¢ Minimum of 3 yrs experience in property management
‚Ä¢ High School Diploma required
‚Ä¢ High level of proficiency in written, verbal, and arithmetic skills
‚Ä¢ Ability to plan and juggle multi task environment and lead maintenance team
‚Ä¢ Ability to earn future designations as required by Industry standards, EPA regulations, OSHA requirements, etc.
‚Ä¢ Must possess solid knowledge of carpentry, electrical, plumbing, etc. information as required by daily operations
‚Ä¢ Must pass FCM Maintenance Skills Competency Test
‚Ä¢ Working Environment/Requirements*
The majority of time during a typical work day is conducted out on the property, requiring the ability to walk great distances, lift up to 75lbs., climb and be comfortable performing roof work, operate heavy machinery, and withstand extreme outdoor temperatures. A small portion of time will be spent in an office environment, maintaining records and vendor/supply ordering. The associate must have his or her own hand tools and some equipment as dictated by needs of the community and Regional Maintenance Director. In addition, the associate must have a smartphone device where apps can be utilized (First Communities will provide a cell phone allowance to support this requirement) and reliable transportation.

Join us as a Global NVIDIA Channel Solutions FMM, Sr. Consultant on our Solutions CoC team in Austin, TX to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact...

What you‚Äôll achieve

In the Solutions CoC and in direct partnership with the Channel Sales organization, you will be instrumental in aligning NVIDIA‚Äôs Global Channel Programs into Dell‚Äôs Global Channel GTM Strategies and Initiatives. You will serve as the Dell liaison for all NVIDIA Global Channel programs and interface with and through the Dell NA Channel Chief‚Äôs Sales Teams. You will be the recognized representative of NVIDIA channel GTM strategies and programs across Dell channel marketing and identify Dell channel marketing program requirements months in advance of the deadlines required to support Dell channel integration.

You will:
‚Ä¢ Align Dell partners to NVIDIA Annual Channel Objectives and priorities
‚Ä¢ Secure Dell Titanium Partner participation in one NVIDIA OEM channel marketing campaign via a MSA (IDG, Tech Target, MRP) per quarter.
‚Ä¢ Track & Confirm NVIDIA Certification status
‚Ä¢ Drive Dell participation to and track promotion of Dell sessions at GTC

‚Ä¢ Manage projects or customer relationships of critical importance
‚Ä¢ Creatively and strategically supports key business objectives
‚Ä¢ Build external alliances with customers and industry experts to gain and share information and industry trends.
‚Ä¢ Solve problems without precedent and applies thought leadership.
‚Ä¢ Ensure NVIDIA and DELL products and services are aligned with current and future needs and expectations.

Take the first step towards your dream career

Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here‚Äôs what we are looking for with this role:

Essential Requirements
‚Ä¢ Dell Channel or other related Channel related experience and deep understanding of the Channel RTM
‚Ä¢ The person must have the ability to work cross functionally with and through Dell‚Äôs Global Channel Marketing organizations to perform tasks such as but not limited to:

‚Ä¢ Coordination and alignment of said activities and programs into Dell‚Äôs quarterly channel strategies
‚Ä¢ Self-directed and ability to drive projects to successful outcomes within a fast-paced environment
‚Ä¢ Strong team and partnering skills that prove your ability to work cross functionally in order to achieve desired results
‚Ä¢ 12+ years of related experience
‚Ä¢ Good understanding of the competition
‚Ä¢ Deep knowledge of markets and products
‚Ä¢ Experienced Management Consultant and/or Strategic plus Operational Planner
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated strong analytical and problem-solving skills
‚Ä¢ Excellent presentation & cross-functional engagement abilities; strong executive presence
‚Ä¢ Ability to deliver quality results to deadlines Demonstrated career of success in working in cross functional/regional teams & project management
‚Ä¢ Ability to deal with ambiguity and have a strong drive for results
‚Ä¢ Exceptional written and verbal communication skills

Desirable Requirements
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree, postgraduate degree or MBA degree strongly preferred
‚Ä¢ Understanding of products and their value to the customer ‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢ Ability to influence others to achieve results and to work effectively with senior management

Here‚Äôs our story; now tell us yours

Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We‚Äôre proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What‚Äôs most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn‚Äôt stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what‚Äôs next in technology, starting today.

description:
Services Product Manager (Online Transformation)

Dell Technologies is a collective of customer-obsessed, industry-leading visionaries. We believe that technology is essential for driving human progress, and the technology we provide transforms the way we all work and live. But we are more than a technology company ‚Äî we are a people company. We recognize that over 150,000 employees across six... continents have different interests and aspirations. We inspire, challenge and respect each and every one of them, every day. And we provide them with unparalleled growth and development opportunities.

Dell Technology Services is a mature, profitable, over $100B business that is a key area of strategic growth for the company. To support the strong business growth, we are expanding our Online Services Product Management team and the Product Management Consultant will be a key contributor of the overall Online transformation strategy for delivering revenue and margin goals. The Product Management team is responsible for enabling all service offers for online sales and customer self-serve motion globally through a variety of routes to market and channels. The Product Management Consultant is the voice of the customer and will be responsible for overall strategy and management.

Join us as a Services Product Manager on our Engineering Development team in Austin, TX or U.S. remote to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.

What you‚Äôll achieve
As a Services Product Manager, you will profile online market and customer needs to provide insights into online sales and customer self-serve planning process, from multiple sources: sales/marketing teams, primary and secondary market research, customer interviews, industry analysts, and mining of internal customer data. You will evaluate external online sales and customer self-serve capabilities, industry trends, best practices including competitive analysis.

‚ÄãYou will:
‚Ä¢ Evaluate internal online sales and customer self-serve capabilities, gaps for all sales segments, products, and customer types.
‚Ä¢ Evaluate historical business performance both offline and online sales and current year growth targets. Develop three-year opportunity sizing and incremental growth targets.
‚Ä¢ Develop online sales and customer self-serve vision, use cases, customer journeys and requirements for all sales segments, products, and customer types in collaboration with key business partners.
‚Ä¢ Develop online capabilities roadmap that enables 100% online sales and customer self-serve motion
‚Ä¢ Partner with peer service product and program managers, technology strategy teams, sales organizations, marketing, and merchandizing and dell digital teams and lead the development of technologies for online sales and customer self-service.
‚Ä¢ Evaluate current services offers, offline vs online revenue, barriers to online presence and growth and develop plan to enable them 100% transactable online.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with BU Leaders, Technology & Dell Digital leaders to align online technology strategies into comprehensive portfolios for the BU.
‚Ä¢ Drives new product launches and schedules through a multi-phased RAPID Offer Lifecycle Process (OLP) starting from the business concept stage of the development through to a successful worldwide launch.

Essential Requirements
‚Ä¢ 12+ years of related experience in a professional role with a Bachelor‚Äôs degree; or 8+ years with a Master‚Äôs degree; or 5+ years with a PhD; or equivalent experience.
‚Ä¢ Must be a strong team player with a proven ability to drive change through influence and collaboration across a matrix organization in a highly fluid environment.
‚Ä¢ Strong experience in working with both business & technology partners.
‚Ä¢ Substantial knowledge of Product Management and Engineering Development methodologies.
‚Ä¢ Understand macro-business economics and be able to build actionable business plans and prioritize and categorize in complex and highly matrixed environments.
‚Ä¢ Premier communicator with exemplary writing skills and an innate ability to make very complex concepts and offerings simple and intuitive. Demonstrate the ability to influence/sell ideas and present alternatives in a convincing fashion to a mixed audience, from peers to executives.
‚Ä¢ Proven track record as a decisive, action-oriented individual, who has led cross-functional global teams to define and achieve high value objectives. This individual will have the ability to coalesce varied constituents and drive to achieve superior results on a consistent basis.
‚Ä¢ Possess the technical knowledge and business understanding well enough to identify/define Services direction, requirements & gaps. Possess a track record of having successfully delivered on complex projects and possess global experience.

Desirable Requirements
‚Ä¢ MBA, or Masters degree
‚Ä¢ Pragmatic Marketing certified
‚Ä¢ Understanding of the Offer Lifecycle Process (OLP)
‚Ä¢ Familiar with Dell Products & Services

Here‚Äôs our story; now tell us you

Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We‚Äôre proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What‚Äôs most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn‚Äôt stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what‚Äôs next in technology, starting today.

You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.

description: OVERVIEW Experience a perfect blend of deliberate purpose and clear-eyed vision. At Ulta Beauty, some of the industry‚Äôs most highly-esteemed beauty leaders share themselves, as well as their expertise. Building authentic community. Creating a real sense of belonging‚Äîeven as they‚Äôre plotting a bold, strategic course of exciting innovations destined to revolutionize the industry. Think robust organizational support. Ever-increasing levels of investment. And a healthy dose of personal empowerment and growth opportunity. All with a company of unwavering strength and stability. We are the future of beauty services. Be part of the transformation. We invite you to submit your application as we may have positions open now or in the near future, depending on current business needs. THE IMPACT YOU CAN HAVE: On a daily basis, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to learn from more experienced salon professionals and display your artistry in ways that draw out the potential in all guests‚Äîdelighting them... with the newest trends and ideas, enhancing their esteem, and setting them loose to conquer their worlds. Seriously. Could anything be more rewarding? You‚Äôll accomplish all of this by: Building personal and professional rapport with all guests and Ulta Beauty Associates Providing professional product recommendations as part of all services Learning from and assisting an Elite or Master Hair Stylist mentor Meeting/exceeding all individual sales and productivity goals Attending mandatory educations events and workshops Assisting in store duties (e.g., filling Salon retail displays and shelves.) Adhering to all Salon standards for guest service and cleanliness Attending manager led monthly business development meetings to support personal business growth Demonstrating your personal style (while adhering to the Ulta Beauty dress code) THE ESSENTIALS FOR SUCCESS: Qualified candidates will be 18+ years-old with a Cosmetology diploma and license (no relevant work experience is necessary). Additional requirements include: Basic understanding of the latest salon techniques for performing hair design, color, texture, hair treatments, makeup applications, and ear piercing (where applicable) Basic understanding of the use of equipment and chemicals needed to perform technical work Basic understanding to demonstrate, recommend, and sell pro hair care and makeup products Developed communication skills Ability to work independently and as part of a team Ability to build and maintain strong customer relationships SPECIAL POSITION REQUIREMENTS Work a flexible schedule to include days, evenings, weekends, and holidays WORKING CONDITIONS Frequent mobility during shift, including reaching, twisting, and neck movement Frequent eye/hand coordination for guest services and use of computer Continuous lifting and/or moving up to 10 lbs. during shift, with the ability to lift and/or move up to 40 lbs. Less frequent stooping, kneeling, and crouching during shift Less frequent ability to pull and push a rolling cart Ability to stand for long periods of time during shift Climb a ladder and maintain balance during shift ABOUT At Ulta Beauty (NASDAQ: ULTA), the possibilities are beautiful. Ulta Beauty is the largest North American beauty retailer and the premier beauty destination for cosmetics, fragrance, skin care products, hair care products and salon services. We bring possibilities to life through the power of beauty each and every day in our stores and online with more than 25,000 products from approximately 500 well-established and emerging beauty brands across all categories and price points, including Ulta Beauty‚Äôs own private label. Ulta Beauty also offers a full-service salon in every store featuring‚Äîhair, skin, brow, and make-up services. We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with arrest records, conviction records, or other criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of any applicable state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles‚Äô Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, and the New York City Fair Chance Act

title: none
description:
LiveRamp is the leading data connectivity platform. We believe connected data has the power to change the world. Our platform powers insights and experiences centered around the needs of real people, and in ways that keep the Internet open for all. LiveRampers thrive on building together with curiosity and humility‚Äîand have a good bit of fun along the way. We‚Äôre always looking for smart, kind... and creative people to grow our team and impact.

Mission: LiveRamp makes it safe and easy for businesses to use data effectively.

As a Senior Business Process Analyst, you have responsibility for the end-to-end business processes aligning Infrastructure & Operations data and process flows. You are a collaborator, co-creator and you 'act like an owner' in solving problems and challenges together with the business.

You Will
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand process flows and document requirements as Infrastructure & Operations implements new tools and capabilities.
‚Ä¢ Organize and drive business process re-engineering initiatives to identify current pain points and uncover process/data gaps by facilitating discovery discussions/sessions/workshops and conducting solution presentations.
‚Ä¢ Perform business process modeling, data flow, user experience modeling, and basic technical architecture diagramming for the entire customer journey through various software systems.
‚Ä¢ Create an inventory of process pain points and gaps in industry best practices in each functional area.
‚Ä¢ Participate in design sessions with the technical team of architects, application administrators, and developers, documenting solution options with detailed supporting materials such as business process diagrams, wireframes, and other context diagrams.
‚Ä¢ Work with Infrastructure & Operations managers to review current processes and identify "As Is" and "To Be" models within identified tools/solutions that automate the processes.
‚Ä¢ Perform rapid analysis and decomposition of complex business information into functional process components or specifications.
‚Ä¢ Interpret technical and business strategy and enterprise application roadmaps.
‚Ä¢ Participate and guide our internal functional teams through user acceptance test planning and execution as processes are implemented in identified tools and functions.

Your Team

The Business Technology (BT) team at LiveRamp is responsible for delivering great user experiences through secure, scalable technology and enables processes that power the business and help LiveRamp achieve its mission. To do this, we collaborate deeply with the best of minds and teams at LiveRamp that run our business.

About You
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education.
‚Ä¢ A seasoned professional with 10 years in a business analyst or process analyst role.
‚Ä¢ Experience within a publicly-traded high-growth PaaS/SaaS company is preferred.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrable expertise in end-to-end technology processes.
‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with industry leading process and workflow tools such as ITSM platforms, DevOps platforms, and request management systems.
‚Ä¢ Drive and resolve in overcoming challenges and seeking new innovative solutions.
‚Ä¢ Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex information in a clear, concise manner to all audiences.
‚Ä¢ Excellent influencing skills with an ability to build consensus, facilitate change, and communicate at all levels in the organization (executive, functional, technical).

Benefits:
‚Ä¢ People: Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.
‚Ä¢ Fun: We host in-person and virtual events such as game nights, happy hours, camping trips, and sports leagues.
‚Ä¢ Work/Life Harmony: Flexible paid time off, paid holidays, options for working from home, and paid parental leave.
‚Ä¢ Whole Health Package: Medical, dental, vision, life, disability, long term care, accident and critical illness insurance, pre-tax accounts (health, dependent and commuter), and a family forming benefit through Carrot. Plus Milk Stork, backup child and elder care, and discount on pet insurance, mental health support (via Talkspace)
‚Ä¢ FlexPerks reimbursement program to provide flexibility and choice ($375/quarter) for fitness, emotional, financial, family, travel and entertainment, convenience and security expenses. (U.S. LiveRampers)
‚Ä¢ Savings: Our 401K matching plan‚Äî1:1 match up to 6% of salary‚Äîhelps you plan ahead. Also Employee Stock Purchase Plan - 15% discount off purchase price of LiveRamp stock (U.S. LiveRampers)
‚Ä¢ RampRemote: A comprehensive office equipment and ergonomics program‚Äîwe prove you with equipment and tools to be your most productive self, no matter where you're located.
‚Ä¢ Location: Work from home (remote-eligible roles)

More about us:

LiveRamp‚Äôs mission is to connect data in ways that matter, and doing so starts with our people. We know that inspired teams enlist people from a blend of backgrounds and experiences. And we know that individuals do their best when they not only bring their full selves to work but feel like they truly belong. Connecting LiveRampers to new ideas and one another is one of our guiding principles‚Äîone that informs how we hire, train, and grow our global team across nine countries and four continents. Click here to learn more about Diversity, Inclusion, & Belonging (DIB) at LiveRamp.

LiveRamp is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer (AA/EOE/W/M/Vet/Disabled) and does not discriminate in recruiting, hiring, training, promotion or other employment of associates or the awarding of subcontracts because of a person's race, color, sex, age, religion, national origin, protected veteran, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetics or other protected status. Qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for the position in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

California residents: Please see our California Personnel Privacy Policy for more information regarding how we collect, use, and disclose the personal information you provide during the job application process.

To all recruitment agencies: LiveRamp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, LiveRamp employees or any other company location. LiveRamp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: none
description:
ROLE

QuoteWizard by LendingTree has launched a brand-new innovative product into the automotive retail marketplace and our team is expanding. We are currently seeking a talented and successful people person to join the team as a District Sales Manager in the state of Texas. The District Sales Manager will engage, present and close business with automotive dealership management by introducing and... performing demonstrations of our new car insurance marketplace platform. This role will be marketing our new platform in their primary metropolitan to start, but with growth is not limited to that specific metro. This person will be responsible for maintaining the highest level of professionalism and providing a great customer experience to all clients, while consistently meeting and/or exceeding monthly sales goals. This will be a performance-based role where you will utilize your people skills, creativity, and selling skills to exceed goals.

RESPONSIBILITIES
‚Ä¢ Engage, present and close new business sales via phone, on-site meetings, and cold walk-ins with dealership management personnel.
‚Ä¢ Manage and maintain the velocity of all deals through the pipeline.
‚Ä¢ Achieve and exceed quarterly sales goals.
‚Ä¢ Timely communication of customer questions to appropriate company resources and follow up to insure resolution and/or customer satisfaction.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate and support team members in an open and encouraging environment.
‚Ä¢ Document all activities and forecast business diligently within SalesForce CRM.
‚Ä¢ Other duties and projects will be assigned as needed.

QUALIFICATIONS
‚Ä¢ 2+ years demonstrated selling skills and a consistent track record of exceeding goals from new business in a dynamic selling environment.
‚Ä¢ A natural ability to generate positive relationships with both customers and prospects.
‚Ä¢ Ability to resolve issues on their behalf to insure happiness and drive business to closure.
‚Ä¢ You are hungry, driven, and self-motivated. Ability to successfully cold call into accounts and generate a large amount of activity to fill the pipeline with qualified opportunities.
‚Ä¢ Ability to handle multiple concurrent tasks and prospects concurrently.
‚Ä¢ Ability to quickly adapt to changes in priority as our business & product evolves.
‚Ä¢ You are proficient with standard corporate productivity tools (Email, SalesForce, Excel, etc).
‚Ä¢ Excellent oral and written communication skills.
‚Ä¢ High School Diploma required.
‚Ä¢ Flexible in hours (possible nights and/or weekends when applicable but not typical).
‚Ä¢ Travel within the state of TX may be required.
‚Ä¢ Own a reliable vehicle with current insurance.
‚Ä¢ Strong background in automotive retail such as training/relationship experience with automotive dealerships, consulting, former GM/GSM/Dealer/F&I or Sales experience. For instance, if you‚Äôre a current leader or top producer in your dealership/company but you‚Äôre searching for something where you can utilize your automotive retail background/skills to improve your work/life balance; this might be a great role for you. (Preferred but not necessary)
‚Ä¢ Entrepreneur at heart (Preferred but not necessary)

WE OFFER
‚Ä¢ Base salary plus uncapped commission structure.
‚Ä¢ Reimbursement for phone and mileage driven.
‚Ä¢ Full Benefits ‚Äì medical/dental/vision/401K/Stock Options as well as paid holidays and unlimited time off.
‚Ä¢ Servicing is done by our carrier partners to allow you to focus exclusively on our dealership partners.
‚Ä¢ A new & exciting technology product with incredible growth potential including beyond this current role and territory.

COMPANY

Our office is in downtown Seattle, in the heart of Pioneer Square. We cultivate a comfortable work environment, with plenty of onsite amenities (gym, locker room, lunch area, snacks, TVs, casual attire, ping pong, etc.). Come join a diverse and growing workforce of over 200 smart, driven people.

What you should know about LendingTree, our parent company:
‚Ä¢ We are a publicly traded company (TREE).
‚Ä¢ We have welcomed several other companies into the LendingTree family to augment our efforts at helping borrowers make their most sensible financial choices.
‚Ä¢ We have built the LendingTree app and My LendingTree dashboard to give consumers tools to manage and monitor their financial health.
‚Ä¢ We still make funny commercials.

CULTURE

We are a fast-paced company with an entrepreneurial bend. We work hard and test our products often. We are collaborative, ambitious, candid, and high-energy. Our teammates are some of the brightest, most talented people you will ever work with. We care more about your smarts than we do about the kinds of clothes you wear (but please, do wear clothes to work!), and we‚Äôre pretty good about rewarding innovation, creativity and the knack for just getting stuff done (we even have an award for employees called the GSD, ‚ÄúGet Stuff Done‚Äù).

Come work with us!

QuoteWizard by LendingTree is the kind of company that not only promotes diversity and inclusion; we thrive because of these values. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion (or creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status
